• The process has several advantages, including improved product yield, reduced impurities, and ease of operation
  • The process is also adaptable to industrial production and can be used to prepare a variety of pyrazolotriazoles with different properties and applications
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from a plurality of fiber types.
    * The method involves measuring the total height of each fiber bale, determining a partial quantity to be removed, and removing the partial quantity from the fiber bale.
    * The apparatus includes a fiber removing apparatus, a quantity measuring apparatus, and a control apparatus.
    * The fiber removing apparatus removes fibers from the fiber bales, and the quantity measuring apparatus measures the height of the fiber bales.
    * The control apparatus controls the mode of operation of the fiber removing apparatus based on the measurements from the quantity measuring apparatus.
    * The method and apparatus are designed to ensure that the opening of all fiber bales is effected without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics.
    • The fabric is formed by laying yarns at an angle to the direction of fabric formation.
    • The yarns are laid on a conveyor belt with needles that extend outwardly from the conveyor belt.
    • The yarns are then wrapped around or impaled on the needles to form a layer of the fabric.
    • The fabric can be formed with multiple layers, with each layer laid at a different angle to the direction of fabric formation.
    • The fabric can be bonded together using a stitching machine, knitting machine, or adhesive.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom, where the weft threads have different thicknesses and require different weft carrying forces.
  • The invention provides a pneumatic piping system that includes subnozzles divided into different groups for producing different weft carrying forces.
    • The subnozzles are arranged along the warp shed and are capable of producing the same weft carrying force.
    • The weft carrying forces are produced by varying the interval of time in which air is ejected or by varying air ejecting forces.
  • The invention also provides a control system that includes a regulator, a subtank, and on-off valves for controlling the air pressure and flow to the subnozzles.
    • The control system is controlled by a weft selection signal and an on-off command signal, which are generated by a control unit.
    • The control unit is connected to a sensor that detects the rotation of a weft insertion control cam and an encoder that reads the angular displacement of the loom shaft.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibres, including health preserving, opening, cleaning, carding, and spinning the fibres.
    * The process involves health preserving the bast fibres under specific temperature and humidity conditions, which improves the flexibility and spinnability of the fibres.
    * The invention also relates to a multi-fibre yarn produced by blending bast fibres with other fibres, such as cotton, terylene, or polypropylene, and health preserving the blended fibres under specific conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sensing roll for use in a nip press, which is used to exert pressing forces on webs for forming paper, textile material, plastic foil, and other related materials.
  • The sensing roll includes multiple sensors disposed along its length, with each sensor measuring the pressure being exerted on it as it enters the nip region.
    • The sensors are spaced apart circumferentially on the roll, with each sensor measuring the pressure at a particular cross-directional position.
    • The sensors are used to calculate and display the nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile of the sensing roll.
• The sensing roll is designed to remove the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile, providing a more accurate representation of the pressure being developed along the nip region.
  • The sensing roll can be used in various industries, including paper, textile, and plastic foil manufacturing.
    • The sensing roll can be used to monitor and adjust the nip pressure profile in real-time, allowing for improved control over the manufacturing process.
    • The sensing roll can also be used to detect and diagnose problems with the roll or the nip press, such as wear and tear or misalignment.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and holder for an article, particularly useful for an ironing board.
  * It has a releasable clamp that secures the apparatus to the ironing board, and a flexible cord support that holds the electrical cord above the ironing surface.
  * The article holder is detachable and can be mounted to the clamp, allowing for storage and flexibility.
* The cord support has a foot that is pivotably and slideably received by an opening in the clamp, allowing for movement between a raised and retracted position.
  * The foot has a tab that is retained by a detent in the clamp, holding the cord support in the raised position.
  * The cord support also has a coiled spring resilient section that provides flexibility and allows the cord to be supported above the ironing surface.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention relates to buttonhole controlling devices for a sewing machine.
    * Buttonhole controlling devices which a sewing machine operator may use to select the length of a buttonhole to be sewn and which are effective to cause a machine when in a buttonhole mode to automatically sew a buttonhole of the selected length are well known.
    * However, such devices may not produce the desired result in other fabrics due to the fact that different materials vary in the extent to which they slip relative to the feed dog of a machine during sewing.
    * The present invention aims to provide a buttonhole controlling device which can be rendered effective regardless of the type of material being sewn to cause buttonhole stitching to close without overlap.
* Object of the Invention
    * The object of the present invention is to provide a buttonhole controlling device which can be rendered effective regardless of the type of material being sewn to cause buttonhole stitching to close without overlap.
* Description of the Invention
    * The buttonhole controlling device of the invention includes a foot pad which attaches to a presser bar, and a travelling assembly having an initial position relative to the foot pad as defined by oppositely acting springs.
    * The travelling assembly moves with work fed during the sewing of a buttonhole and includes a slidable member that may be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.
    * The slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine during movement of the assembly and cause the length of a buttonhole formed with the buttonhole device be limited to that suitable for the button inserted in the travelling assembly.
    * An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole.
* Description of the Drawings
    * FIG. 1 is a fragmentary head end elevational view of a sewing machine including the buttonhole controlling device of the invention.
    * FIG. 2 is a fragmentary plan view taken substantially on the plane of the line 2--2 of FIG. 1, and showing the travelling assembly on the device of the invention in an initial position.
    * FIG. 3 is a view similar to FIG. 2 showing the travelling assembly upon completion of a bar at the end of the first leg of a buttonhole.
    * FIG. 4 is a fragmentary perspective view showing the travelling assembly at the completion of the buttonhole.

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid.
    * The apparatus is designed to improve the washing effect and reduce the tension in the textile web.
    * The invention is particularly useful for treating knitted fabrics and printed materials.

* Object of the Invention
    * The object of the invention is to provide an improved apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid.
    * The apparatus should be able to adequately effectuate washing or rinsing without maintaining the textile web in a stacked configuration.
    * The apparatus should be able to treat a wide range of textile materials, including knitted fabrics and printed materials.

* Summary of the Invention
    * The invention comprises a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
    * The conveyor includes an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined path.
    * The liquid applicator is disposed at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion.

* Dwell Stretch
    * The dwell stretch is designed to conduct the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
    * The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass or a sieve drum.
    * The dwell stretch enables the textile web to be guided with little tension.

* Suction Device
    * The suction device is disposed at a second station along the path for removing the liquid from the web by suction during motion.
    * The suction device is preferably disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt.
    * The suction device causes the textile web to adhere to the belt and to be entrained thereby.

* Embodiments
    * The invention can be embodied in a fabric treatment apparatus with a single dwell stretch or multiple dwell stretches.
    * The dwell stretches can be formed by air passes or sieve drums.
    * The invention can be used to treat a wide range of textile materials, including knitted fabrics and printed materials.

* Advantages
    * The invention provides an improved apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid.
    * The apparatus is able to adequately effectuate washing or rinsing without maintaining the textile web in a stacked configuration.
    * The apparatus is able to treat a wide range of textile materials with little tension.

* Conclusion
    * The invention provides an improved apparatus for treating a dyed or

<summary>
• **Air Flow System**
    • Provides ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened
    • Prevents solvent vapors from escaping through the access opening
    • Isolated from the air recirculating system during the dry cycle
    • Uses a blower and valves to control airflow

• **Solvent Flow System**
    • Recirculates solvent through filters and back to the storage tank
    • Prevents solvent from being exhausted to the atmosphere
    • Uses valves and pumps to control solvent flow
    • Includes a backwash cycle to clean the filters

• **Refrigeration System**
    • Cools the storage tank to maintain a predetermined temperature
    • Uses a compressor and evaporator coils to cool the tank
    • Can be controlled by a thermostat or timer
    • Oversized to accommodate varying load conditions

• **Timer and Controls**
    • Controls the machine's operation through a timer mechanism
    • Includes a "cartridge dry" mode for drying filter cartridges
    • Uses a switch to select between normal and "cartridge dry" modes
    • Includes a door switch to prevent operation when the door is open

• **Air Flow During Cycle**
    • Air flows through the tubs during the wash and dry cycles
    • Air is circulated through the tubs during the dry cycle
    • Air is exhausted through the access opening during the dry cycle
    • Air is prevented from flowing through the tubs during the spin cycle

• **Solvent Vapor Handling**
    • Solvent vapors are removed from the tubs and stored in a bag
    • The bag is evacuated during the dry cycle
    • Solvent vapors are condensed and returned to the storage tank
    • The system prevents solvent vapors from escaping to the atmosphere

• **Dry Cycle**
    • The dry cycle includes a tumble drying phase
    • The tumble drying phase uses a blower and heated air
    • The dry cycle also includes a condenser phase
    • The condenser phase uses a refrigeration system to condense solvent vapors

• **Cartridge Dry Mode**
    • The cartridge dry mode is used to dry filter cartridges
    • The mode is selected by a switch on the control panel
    • The mode uses the timer and motor controls to dry the cartridges
    • The mode is used to reclaim residual solvent from the cartridges

• **Machine Operation**
    • The machine is operated by a customer

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments and nonwoven webs.
  • The method involves quenching molten polymer in a quench chamber and then drawing the filaments through a slot opening to form a web.
    • The quench chamber has a quench fluid, usually air, that is maintained at a temperature in the range of 40°F to 200°F.
    • The quench fluid is supplied under pressure of less than 4 bar, preferably less than 2 bar.
    • The filaments are drawn through the slot opening at a velocity of 3,000 to 21,000 meters per minute.
    • The slot opening is formed by two air knives that are adjustable to change the size of the opening and the velocity of the air.
    • The filaments are collected on a conveyor belt and can be bonded together to form a nonwoven web.
    • The invention is useful for forming fine continuous filaments and nonwoven webs from a variety of polymers, including polyamides, polyesters, and polyolefins.
    • The invention has several advantages, including the ability to produce fine filaments, high production rates, and good web uniformity.
    • The invention is useful for a variety of applications, including the production of nonwoven webs for use in sanitary products, industrial filtration, and automotive applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• **Sewing Machine Overview**
	• The sewing machine is a device that can perform sewing in a specified position on a work cloth.
	• It includes a bed, a pillar, an arm, and a head.
	• The head has a needle plate, a presser bar, and a needle bar mechanism.
	• The sewing machine also includes a control portion, a CPU, a ROM, a RAM, and an EEPROM.

• **Ultrasonic Pen**
	• The ultrasonic pen is a device that can transmit an ultrasonic wave to the sewing machine.
	• It includes a pen body and a pen tip.
	• The pen tip is provided at the leading end of the pen body.
	• The pen body includes a switch, a signal output circuit, and an ultrasonic transmitter.

• **Receivers**
	• The receivers are devices that can detect the ultrasonic wave transmitted by the ultrasonic pen.
	• They are provided on the sewing machine and are separated from each other.
	• The receivers are above the top surface of the bed and are not extremely far from the origin.

• **Position Identification**
	• The sewing machine can identify the position of the ultrasonic pen on the work cloth by detecting the ultrasonic wave.
	• The position is identified by solving simultaneous equations based on the detected ultrasonic wave.
	• The sewing machine can calculate the specified coordinates E (Xe, Ye, Ze) on the work cloth.

• **Conditions for Receiver Position**
	• The receivers should be in positions that satisfy conditions (A) to (E).
	• Condition (A): an object is unlikely to enter between the ultrasonic pen and the receivers.
	• Condition (B): the receivers are separated from each other to some extent.
	• Condition (C): the distance from the origin to the receivers in the X direction and the Y direction is large.
	• Condition (D): the distance from the origin to the receivers is not extremely large.
	• Condition (E): the receivers are provided above the top surface of the bed.

• **Advantages**
	• The sewing machine can accurately identify the position of the ultrasonic pen on the work cloth.
	• The sewing machine can perform sewing in the specified position.
	• The sewing machine can reduce the influence of the thickness of the work cloth on the calculation result.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to fabrics and textiles, particularly cellulosic fabric or textile materials, and methods of applying functional utility-enhancing preparations onto these materials.
    • The invention provides a preparation comprising a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, which carries functional additives to enhance the durability of functional enhancements of a cellulosic fabric material.
    • The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below, and the functional additives include anti-UV agents, anti-bacterial agents, and ultrafine bamboo powder for improving moisture management properties.
    • The preparation is applied to the cellulosic fabric material using various methods, including printing, padding, or foam application, and the treated fabric exhibits improved ultraviolet protection, wicking, and wrinkle recovery properties.
    • The invention also provides a method of preparing the preparation, which involves pulverizing wool fibre into ultrafine powder, adding functional additives, and forming an aqueous suspension with a binding agent.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is an automatic quilting machine that can sew patterns into large fabrics such as bedspreads and quilts.
  • It has a frame quilting table that can move in the X and Y directions to position the fabric for sewing.
    • The table is controlled by a process controller that receives input from a joystick or mouse and sends commands to DC motors to move the table.
    • The table can move at high speeds and can be programmed to move in any direction and at any speed.
  • The sewing machine head is separate from the table and is controlled by its own process controller.
    • The sewing machine head can perform stitching functions and auxiliary functions such as trim and tension release.
    • The sewing machine process controller receives commands from the main process controller and controls the sewing machine accordingly.
    • The main process controller can be programmed to control the sewing machine and the table movement independently, allowing for easy modification of patterns and stitching functions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods of making nonwoven fabrics, particularly a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric exhibiting a three-dimensional image.
    * The fabric is formed from a first precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web comprising a second fibrous matrix.
        * The precursor webs are subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
        * The image transfer device defines three-dimensional elements against the precursor web, displacing the first fibrous matrix into the three-dimensional topography while retaining the second fibrous matrix on the side away from the three-dimensional topography.
        * The fabric exhibits a pronounced image and a fiber distribution control layer, which deters the excessive intermingling of the first and second fibrous matrices.
    * The fabric can be used in various applications, including home, medical, and hygiene products.
        * The fabric can be used in disposable absorbent hygiene articles, such as sanitary napkins, incontinence pads, and diapers.
        * The fabric can be used in medical gauze or similar absorbent surgical materials for absorbing wound exudates.
        * The fabric can be used in protective wear for medical and industrial uses, such as gowns, shirts, and face masks.
        * The fabric can be used in protective covers for vehicles and equipment.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
    * The device includes a control setup that includes a stop in the feed path of the strip for contacting the feed path and preventing feed thereof when the strip is not fed in correct association with the fabric.
* The stop is carried by a doubled arm lever member which is part of a control means including a control switch and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop.
    * The setting means includes an air cylinder and a piston rod that is connected to the lever member.
* The device also includes a guide apparatus for guiding the strip of material into the stitch forming area of the sewing machine.
    * The guide apparatus includes a lateral flange and is screwed to a plate that is conformable to an arcuate web and slants toward the stitch forming area.
* The device operates as follows: the trailing edge of the strip loses contact with a contact arm, which causes the sewing machine to stop and the presser foot to lift.
    * The stop is then moved into the feed path of the strip, and the strip is fed into the stitch forming area until it butts against the stop.
* The device also includes a sequence control that starts the sewing machine again after the stop has left the contact area of the presser foot.
    * The sequence control includes a solenoid valve that is controlled by a proximity switch and a sequence control known per se.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various applications.
  * The method is used to join the end portions of two tape-shaped knit pieces.
  * The knitting machine used in this method is a flat knitting machine with multiple knitting needles disposed on a pair of needle beds.
  * The needle beds are movable in a lateral direction.
  * The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces with a boundary between them on one of the needle beds.
  * The end portions of the knit pieces are then joined by overlaying loops and binding off.
  * The method is repeated a specified number of times to achieve the desired width of the knit fabric.
  * The knit fabric is then terminated by locking the loops and dislocating them from the knitting needles.
  * The invention can be used in various applications, including the collar of a sweater, the neck rope part of a tanktop, the lower end portion of baseball stockings, and the neck rope part of an apron.
  * The method can be controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
	* The invention relates to a flexible traction element with stranded cables and a production line for producing such elements.
	* The traction element has a flexible thermoplastic plastics material jacket and stranded cables with a core strand and peripheral strand cords.
	* The production line includes a system for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, and an extruder for sheathing the stranded cables with the plastics material.
	* The invention provides a method for embedding the stranded cables with a plastics material-coated core strand.
	* The invention also provides a production line for producing band-shaped traction elements with stranded cables.

* Production Line Components
	* The production line includes a system for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, and an extruder for sheathing the stranded cables with the plastics material.
	* The production line also includes a cooling trough for cooling the traction element, a storage roller for winding the traction element, and a cutting device for cutting the traction element to length.
	* The production line can be used to produce traction elements with different cross-sectional shapes and sizes.
	* The production line can also be used to produce traction elements with stranded cables of different thicknesses.

* Stranded Cable Structure
	* The stranded cable has a core strand and peripheral strand cords.
	* The core strand is sheathed with a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer.
	* The peripheral strand cords are stranded around the core strand.
	* The stranded cable can be used as a single cable or as part of a traction element with multiple stranded cables.

* Production Line Operation
	* The production line operates by unwinding the stranded cables, orienting the stranded cables, preheating the stranded cables, and sheathing the stranded cables with the plastics material.
	* The production line can be controlled to produce traction elements with precise dimensions and properties.
	* The production line can be used to produce traction elements with different cross-sectional shapes and sizes.
	* The production line can also be used to produce traction elements with stranded cables of different thicknesses.

* Advantages
	* The invention provides a method for producing traction elements with stranded cables and a production line for producing such elements.
	* The production line can be used to produce traction elements with different cross-sectional shapes and sizes.
	* The production line can also be used to

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, which aims to minimize the impediment of the thread movement during the guiding of the needle thread loop around the bobbin housing.
    * The rotary hook arrangement includes a bobbin housing with a triangular shoulder, a spring rod, and a capsule release device.
        * The bobbin housing has a triangular shoulder with a front and rear side face, which forms a gap with the spring rod.
        * The capsule release device includes an eccentric, an eccentric rod, and a finger, which gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
* The rotary hook arrangement allows for a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, with minimal impediment of the thread movement during the guiding of the needle thread loop around the bobbin housing.
    * The spring rod is bent back by the needle thread loop, causing a slight increase in needle thread tension, but this tension is still lower than with conventional rotary hooks.
        * The capsule release device can be used to eliminate the slight impediment of the thread movement caused by the bending of the spring rod.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides methods for producing silicon-based nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using liquid silane inks.
    * The methods involve electrospinning a viscous solution containing a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent.
    * The liquid silane is preferably cyclohexasilane (Si6H12) or other silanes with similar structures.
    * The polymer is preferably poly(methyl methacrylate) or other polymers with similar properties.
    * The accelerant is preferably a polyhydropolysilane, which accelerates the polymerization of the liquid silane.
    * The solvent is preferably toluene, xylene, cyclooctane, or other solvents with similar properties.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel.
    * The arrangement has a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different spool holder.
        * Each controller has a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension-responsive braking element.
        * The braking element is biased by a tensioning lever, which is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
* The tensioning lever is connected to a biasing arrangement, which is activated by fluid pressure and can be set simultaneously for all spool holders.
    * The biasing arrangement can be formed by a piston-cylinder assembly, which can follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever.
* The tensioning lever subtends an angle of more than 45° to the horizontal plane, and the biasing arrangement subtends an angle of less than 45° to the thread direction.
    * The angle of the tensioning lever and the biasing arrangement can be adjusted to achieve a desired thread tension.
* The arrangement can be used to control the thread tension in a warping machine, and can be shut off quickly by increasing the braking force.
    * The braking force can be controlled by adjusting the fluid pressure in the biasing arrangement.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a sewing machine detector that overcomes the disadvantages of conventional detectors.
  • It uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs to detect sewing machine speed, needle position, and thread trimmer timing.
    • The discs are mounted coaxially to a shaft and have indicator arrows for indicating an angle of rotation.
    • The discs are made of light-transmitting synthetic resin and have printed light shielding areas.
  • The detector also includes an optical fiber supporter that holds the optical fibers in place and minimizes stress on the fibers.
    • The optical fibers are supported linearly and are not flexed when inserted into the supporter.
    • The reflecting portions are stationary and enable optional and additional optical axes to be generated.
    • The detector is less expensive to manufacture and results in a thinner, more compact detecting section.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a process for producing viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
    * The process involves a series of treatments, including partial coagulation, completion of coagulation, washing, and drying.
    * The washing step is critical, as it removes impurities and improves the degree of whiteness.
</summary>

<summary>
* The inventors developed a system for deaerating pulp after oxygen treatment to improve the washing process.
    * The system includes a deaeration tank with a swirl-inducing inlet pipe and a tangential swirl-inducing inlet pipe.
    * The tank is designed to be small and compact, with a diameter of 0.75 to 1.5 times the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
    * The tank has a flat bottom and an open top, and is designed to withstand pressures of ±1 atmosphere.
    * The system uses a filtrate from the washer as the swirling fluid to induce a swirling motion in the pulp.
    * The system is designed to be easy to operate and maintain, with no moving parts and a simple design.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
  • The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and joints, which are designed to optimize the material's performance for specific functions, such as supporting static loads, dissipating vibration energy, or absorbing impact energy.
• The invention uses a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which involves defining the functions of the material, quantifying the objectives, and optimizing the material's design to achieve those objectives.
  • The FOMD process is used to design the BTR composite structure, which is optimized for out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio, and can be used in various applications, such as aerospace, automotive, and marine industries.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a load-limiting device for dissipating energy during a dynamic event, such as an earthquake.
  • The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation in response to high loads, allowing it to absorb and dissipate energy.
    • The device has a connection means that attaches it to a brace in the structure.
    • The device has an opening that allows for connection to the connecting means.
    • The device is designed to be removable and replaceable after a dynamic event.
  • The device is designed to be used in a variety of structures, including buildings, vehicles, and bridges.
    • The device is designed to be used in conjunction with a braced frame system.
    • The device is designed to be used in a variety of shapes and sizes to accommodate different structural applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet that provides a flophouse facility with a number of individual rooms on the floor of an existing building.
  * The bedroom cabinet is designed to have a floor area at least approximately equal to an area of a bed, with a height that allows a user to erect the upper half of their body on the bed, and a circumference that is completely shut off from the outside except for a doorway.
* The bedroom cabinet has a dual construction comprising an outer casing and an inner casing, which provides excellent mechanical strength and allows for the formation of a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing to house electric devices or shelves for accommodating user belongings.
  * The clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing can be used to form a box for accommodating devices such as an illuminating instrument, an interphone, or a radio receiver, or a box that serves as a shelf for accommodating user belongings.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention Overview
    • Portable guard rail support for erecting a safety barrier
    • Meets safety guidelines and regulations
    • Easy installation and removal

• Guard Rail Support
    • Comprises a flat bottomed base plate, upright column, and rail supporting brackets
    • Base plate has bores for anchoring to the floor
    • Rail supporting brackets have bores for securing wooden guard rails

• Assembly of Guard Rail
    • Multiple guard rail supports are located along the perimeter of a floor
    • Upper and lower wooden guard rails are secured within the rail supporting brackets
    • Kick board is secured to the retaining flange

• Alternative Embodiments
    • Concrete-filled steel base for added stability
    • Mesh-like fence structure for added safety

• Safety Regulations
    • Top rail must be at least 3 feet but not more than 3.5 feet above the floor
    • Intermediate rail must be midway between the top rail and the floor
    • Kick board must be at least 3.5 inches in height

• Advantages
    • Easy installation and removal
    • Reduces liability from inadequately re-installed guard rails
    • Durable and reusable

• Applications
    • Temporary guard rail along the outer drop-off edge of a concrete floor slab
    • Temporary guard railing around the perimeter of a roof structure
    • Along the sides of a bridge construction

• Conclusion
    • The invention provides a portable and easy-to-use guard rail support for erecting a safety barrier
    • It meets safety guidelines and regulations and has several advantages
    • It can be used in various applications
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR). The device uses a combination of electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) discharges to stimulate oil-bearing reservoirs.
    * The EH discharge generates a strong acoustic wave that travels outward from the wellbore, while the EM discharge generates a high-frequency acoustic vibration that is induced in the reservoir.
        + The combination of the two discharges allows for stimulation of oil-bearing reservoirs at greater distances than previously possible, and can be used to mobilize oil and increase production.
        + The device can be used in a variety of configurations, including a single-level tool, a multi-level tool, and a tool array in multiple wells.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present disclosure describes a system and method for splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length.
    * The system includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate, each with transverse protrusions and perforations.
    * The method involves coupling the first wave plate to the second wave plate to secure the soil reinforcing element and prevent it from translating laterally.
* The soil reinforcing element can be extended by splicing multiple grid-strips to the end of the soil reinforcing element.
    * The grid-strips can be spliced to the soil reinforcing element using the same wave plates and perforations.
    * The spliced grid-strips can be used to extend the length of the soil reinforcing element to achieve a desired reinforcing distance from the vertical facing.
* The system and method can be used to create a composite soil reinforcing element that provides tensile strength to a vertical facing.
    * The composite soil reinforcing element can be used in various applications, including retaining walls, bridge abutments, dams, seawalls, and dikes.
    * The system and method can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element or to create a composite soil reinforcing element by splicing multiple grid-strips to the end of the soil reinforcing element.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, which is produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production.
    * The plow blade includes a front edge, a top end, and a bottom end, with a fluid tube that travels through the blade to transfer pressurized fluid to the front edge.
        * The fluid tube can be extended to terminate at a position towards the bottom of the critical high friction area, allowing the volume of fluid to be maximized.
        * The number of leading edge sections and the location of the stitch welds can be adjusted to tailor the plow for a specific application.
        * The fluid pressure at a certain point along the blade's length will vary, and the fluid tube can be designed to provide the highest fluid pressure at the point where it is most critical.
* The plow blade can be modified using hand tools, without welding, by replacing nozzles or plugs to control the flow rates and location of the fluid injection.
    * The plow blade can be designed to provide fluid injection characteristics to match specific job requirements, with the components manufactured using traditional manufacturing processes.
        * The flow paths are defined by stacking together leading edge sections with flow voids, and welding or otherwise attaching them to a blade.
        * The plow blade can be tailored to provide appropriate function and provides an easily tailored configuration.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention Overview
  • The invention relates to a building system, including stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, and methods.
  • The invention aims to provide a building system that allows for the creation of larger panels without movement control joints.
  • The invention also aims to provide compliance with building codes and regulations, such as NZS3604 and NZS4251.

• Key Components
  • The invention includes a frame or substructure, battens, a first mesh (inner mesh), a second mesh (outer mesh), and a plaster matrix.
  • The battens are supported from the frame or substructure and carry the inner mesh.
  • The inner mesh is attached to the battens and is wrapped around the framing or substructure.
  • The outer mesh is supported by the plaster matrix and is embedded in the matrix.

• Method of Construction
  • The method of construction involves fixing battens to the support structure, preparing the panel by affixing the inner mesh, applying plaster to the inner mesh, overlaying the plaster with the outer mesh, and applying a third coat of plaster.
  • The method also involves embedding the outer mesh into the plaster matrix.

• Additional Features
  • The invention includes additional features such as regional reinforcement mesh, lattice-like periphery defining members, and flashing members.
  • The flashing members are used to provide a canopy and to receive the inner mesh.
  • The invention also includes a method of forming a stucco type cavity wall structure, which involves fixing battens to the support structure, preparing the panel, and applying plaster to the panel.

• Building Structure
  • The invention includes a building structure comprising a pair of intersecting walls, battens, a lower set of stucco panels, a higher set of stucco panels, and flashing members.
  • The flashing members are used to provide a canopy and to receive the inner mesh.
  • The invention also includes a side jamb assembly and a sill flashed window or door assembly.

• Preferments
  • The invention includes various preferments, such as the use of a specific type of mesh, the use of a specific type of flashing, and the use of a specific type of plaster matrix.
  • The preferments are used to improve the performance and durability of the building system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a new and improved safe and door structure that provides a simple, yet effective locking mechanism.
    * The safe has a liner with a valuables receiving chamber and a door that is received in and removed from the chamber.
        * The door is formed of a plate member with a lockset and a lockbolt that engages a notch in the liner.
        * The door is secured to the liner by a combination of grooves and bar members that provide a secure and tamper-resistant locking mechanism.
        * The safe also includes safety bolts that prevent the lockbolt from being sheared or damaged in the event of an attempted pry.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention of a fluid measuring technique that accurately measures the fluid pressure in the part of the formation that is at the same depth, elevation, or vicinity of the pressure sensor.
    • The technique involves cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in a borehole at a desired location.
    • The conduit is pressurized with fluid to clear the filter of cement grout and displace the grout around the filter to form a fluid connection to the formation.
    • The pressure sensing device is connected to the formation fluid pressure through the filter and measures the pressure of the formation fluid.
    • The invention provides a reliable connection system between the pressure sensing location and the transducer system used to monitor the pressure in the surrounding geological formation.
    • The invention is suitable for use in various reservoir types, including groundwater and petroleum reservoirs.
    • The invention provides a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which includes forming a borehole in the formation, placing a conduit in the borehole, and connecting a pressure sensing device to the conduit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function.
  * The jointing structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
* The elastic members are designed to be hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
  * The elastic members are formed by piling up a thin rubber layer and a steel sheet alternately in multiple layers to place the rubber layers under restraint.
* The joint block is mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap, and supporting blocks are respectively mounted to the opposite sides of the joint block with this joint block between.
  * The joint block and the supporting blocks are of the same concrete as the traveling path and in the shape of a rectangular parallelepiped lengthwise in the direction perpendicular to the axis of the traveling path.
* The jointing structure is designed to prevent the occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations in vehicles and to ensure high slip resistance to tires.
  * The jointing structure is also designed to be easy to maintain and to be adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a floor track system for transporting hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber.
    * This system prevents the brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated.
    * The system also prevents corrosion of the hand truck wheel bearings and deterioration of the rubber wheels.
* The enclosed floor track system includes a wheel channel into which the wheels of the hand truck roll, and a cover plate that overlies the top of the channel.
    * The cover plate is hinged to the channel and can be pivoted away to facilitate cleaning.
    * The channel is supported above the floor by support legs, and the floor is inclined to drain washing fluids into a waste sewer.
* Another embodiment of the system includes inflatable seals that enclose the wheel channel and prevent the brine solution from entering the channel.
    * The seals are attached to the channel sidewalls and are inflated to seal around the hand truck wheels.
    * The seals can be deflated to allow the hand truck to move along the track.
* The system is well adapted for use in a meat product chilling chamber, where it can be used to transport hand trucks loaded with cooked meat products.
    * The system allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, which is cooled by a refrigeration system and recirculated through the chamber.
    * The system also allows for the easy cleaning of the track and the hand truck wheels, which are not exposed to the brine solution.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, particularly a tractor loader backhoe, which prevents the boom from being rotated downward by its own weight.
  * The lock device includes a lock plate, a lock pin, and a guide member.
    * The lock plate is attached to the boom and has a hook part, a forward-slanted surface, and a slot.
    * The lock pin is attached to the boom bracket and serves as an engaged member.
    * The guide member is attached to the boom and guides the lock plate at a prescribed position.
* The lock plate is slidably attached to the boom and can be rotated between a lock position and a release position.
  * In the lock position, the lock plate is engaged with the lock pin and the boom is locked.
  * In the release position, the lock plate is released from the lock pin and the boom is free to rotate.
* The lock device also includes a support pin and a slip-prevention plate to prevent the lock plate from slipping off the slot.
  * The support pin is inserted into the slot and the slip-prevention plate is attached to the tip of the support pin to prevent it from rotating.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform that can be adjusted to regulate suction efficiency.
  • The device has a central, vacuum portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom.
    • The adjustment is accomplished using conveniently located adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head.
  • The device has a first, or outboard roller assembly connected to the platform, and a second, or inboard roller assembly connected to the platform on either side of the central opening.
    • The outboard roller assembly has a pair of spaced apart ribs, or walls, with vertically extending slots and axles that rotatably carry rollers.
    • The inboard roller assembly has a weight housing with spaced apart walls, or ribs, with vertically extending slots and axles that rotatably carry rollers.
  • The device has a frame member that spans the platform and has a central portion and spaced end portions, with downwardly extending legs that receive the axles of the roller assemblies.
    • The frame member has a biasing means, such as a coil spring, that resists downward movement of the frame member.
  • The device can be used with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies, and can be assembled to the existing device with minimum modification.
    • The adjustment device includes a pair of frames, an elongated connector, a wing nut, and a coil spring.
  • The frames are adapted to be positioned over the walls of the housing of the roller construction, and have apertures that receive the axles of the roller construction.
    • The elongated connector is used to connect the frames to the platform of the existing device, and the wing nut is used to adjust the position of the axles within the slots.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing, including a sub-unit for mounting onto a drill string.
  * The apparatus includes a retriever section that is slidably movable along a mandrel section of the sub-unit.
    * The retriever section has a bore that fits around the mandrel section and a plurality of protruding members that engage with a wear bushing to be retrieved.
  * The apparatus also includes a lower collar section that is threadably engaged to the lower end of the mandrel section and a groove section that allows the retriever section to have vertical play while preventing rotational movement.
    * The groove section is engaged by insertion members on the interior wall of the retriever section, allowing the retriever section to move vertically along the mandrel section while preventing rotation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a passage and then closes the passage by landing a plug on a seat.
  • The tool has a modular design that allows the number of pistons to be selected to match the power required for the particular work string or surface equipment available.
    • The tool has a cylindrical valve that eliminates cyclical impacts on opening and closing, allowing for a more reliable and longer-lasting design.
  • The tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle, and can be used in stimulation or fishing operations to provide large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string.
    • The tool has a rotational lock between the mandrel and housing for torque transmission, and can be designed to operate with fewer moving parts than previous designs.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall, which allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site.
  • The retaining wall consists of a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece.
    • The face panel has a front face and a rear surface, and the counterfort extends from the rear surface of the face panel.
    • The base piece is a generally flat platform that is set on grade and has a front lip that protrudes from the end of the base near the face panel.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production therefrom.
  • The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: 
    • The heat is not properly focused where it needs to be
    • Existing down hole heaters fail for lack of design elements which would protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack while in position
  • The present invention provides a down hole heating system that focuses heat in the production zone to promote flow to, and not just within, the production tubing
• The system includes a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods and electrical connections that are impenetrably shielded from the pressures and hostile chemical agents in the well bore
  • The heating unit is designed to overcome the problem of unit invasion by down hole fluids, which causes physical damage and/or electrical shortages
  • The system is designed to contain heat in the production zone to promote flow to, and not just within, the production tubing
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a mechanism for installing and retrieving objects in a well bore.
    * It includes a pulling tool with a collet or spear that can be selectively latched and unlatched.
    * The tool has a latching mechanism that allows for controlled movement of the collet or spear.
* The mechanism includes a compression spring that maintains the collet or spear in a retracted position.
    * The spring is compressed when the tool is moved upwardly, allowing the collet or spear to extend.
* The tool has a guide pin that moves within a recess to control the latching and unlatching of the collet or spear.
    * The guide pin is moved by the compression spring and the latching mechanism.
* The mechanism can be used for various downhole service operations, including installation and removal of downhole tools and fishing operations.
    * It can be used to retrieve stuck or lost tools within the well bore.
* The mechanism can be latched and unlatched multiple times without needing to be removed from the well bore.
    * It can be replaced with a heavier-duty mechanism if needed.

</summary>

<summary>
• Traditional composed stave floors have drawbacks, including:
  • Thin sight substrate (2-3 mm) prone to deformation and detachment
  • Base substrate and sight substrate can suffer from displacement and changes in dimensions
• The present invention aims to address these issues by:
  • Providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm
  • Using multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement, to join the base substrate and sight substrate
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a ladder attachment that improves the lateral stability of the ladder, prevents it from defacing the work surface, and prevents it from slipping or sliding.
    * The attachment includes a flange with openings for a U-bolt, which secures the attachment to the ladder's rung.
        * The flange also has a clamp that abuts the ladder's siderail and is secured with a bolt.
    * The attachment allows the ladder to straddle corners and provides a non-slip gripping portion that grips the work surface without damaging it.
        * The attachment also increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, improving its stability.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a fastener assembly for use in a fastener driving tool, comprising a row of fasteners arranged substantially parallel to each other, and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
  • The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles a shank of each fastener, and a connecting portion that extends between and connects adjacent collar portions.
    • The connecting portion includes a bridge and a rib, with the bridge being a relatively long, thin element that bridges the two adjacent collars, and the rib being a cross-piece to the bridge with a low profile in the nail axial direction.
    • The collation system is formed from an adhesive polymer, an epoxy or the like, and is molded onto the fasteners at an elevated temperature, resulting in a strong adhesive bond between the plastic and the fasteners.
    • The collation system is designed to reduce debris generation during driving of the fasteners, and to provide a strong and rigid strip that resists corrugation and flexing.
    • The collation system can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location, such as by forming a notch at the base of the connecting portion.
    • The collation system can also be designed to have a tapered connecting portion, with the bridge and rib having a tapered shape that narrows in a direction proximal to the tip of the fastener.
    • The collation system can be used in a variety of applications, including construction, manufacturing, and other industries where fasteners are used to join materials together.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries.
  • It provides a device that simplifies the sealing work in both aesthetic appearance and speed of execution.
    • The nozzle has a bell-shaped tip and an injection button, which provides several advantageous and novel characteristics for its intended function.
    • The nozzle can be used in various industries, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
      • It can be used to apply sealants manually or by an extrusion or manual gun.
      • The nozzle provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, which is important for the pressurization and lifetime of aircraft, ships, trains, or automobiles.
• The nozzle can be used to apply sealing cords, filler sealant, or safety cords that ensure there is no liquid between two parts joined by rivets.
  • The nozzle reduces the sealant application time, saving time and labor, and provides a more economical sealing process and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a position sensor that can be used to monitor the position of an object.
    * The sensor generates a signal that is proportional to the distance between the object and a fixed position.
    * The sensor is designed to eliminate strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object.
    * The sensor uses a waveform generator to modify the sensing signal and an error correction generator to remove unwanted signals.
    * The error correction generator uses a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor to generate an error correction signal.
    * The sensor is designed to operate with a minimum of energy and can be used in a multiplexed system.
    * The sensor can be calibrated using a digital-to-analog converter (DAC) and a counter.
    * The sensor can be used in a variety of applications, including internal combustion engines and other mechanical systems.
    * The sensor is designed to be compact and can be used in a variety of environments.
    * The sensor is designed to be reliable and can be used in a variety of applications.
</summary>

<summary>
    * The present invention relates to a valve actuation system for an internal combustion engine, which eliminates the use of springs and provides a highly efficient and precise control of valve port opening.
    *   * The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device that converts the rotary motion of a camshaft into a linear motion, which in turn actuates the valve.
    *   * The valve actuation system is designed to provide a substantially infinitely variable actuation, allowing for precise control of valve port opening and closing.
    *   * The system includes a circular drive disk with a slotted cam track, which can be rotated to adjust the valve displacement.
    *   * The valve displacement can be adjusted by rotating the circular drive disk, allowing for incremental changes in valve opening and closing.
    *   * The system also includes a control block that captures the adjustment pin and maintains its parallelism with the line of action of the slide assembly.
    *   * The control block ensures that the circular drive disk is rotated to the desired angle, and maintains the adjusted position while the valve is operational.
    *   * The system is designed to provide a high degree of precision and control, allowing for efficient and effective operation of the internal combustion engine.
    *   * The system can be used in a variety of engine designs, including four-stroke and two-stroke engines, and can be adapted for use in different types of vehicles.
</summary>

<summary>
• **Light Member Design**
  • Provides a compact and versatile lighting solution for aquariums and other applications
  • Includes a housing with a top and bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side

• **Lighting Control Region**
  • Includes a groove with three channels: a first control channel, a second control channel, and a neutral channel
  • Each channel is controlled independently, allowing for adjustable color temperature and intensity

• **Light-Emitting Modules**
  • Releasably coupled to the lighting control region, allowing for easy installation and removal
  • Each module includes a bottom side with LEDs and a top side with electrical connectors

• **Remote Control**
  • Some constructions include radio frequency (RF) or other communication/control hardware for remote control
  • Allows for remote control of the light member, including color, intensity, and other functionality

• **Timers**
  • Some constructions include digital timers for controlling the light member
  • Timers allow for setting on/off times and dimming duration for each channel

• **Cabinet Mounting**
  • Some constructions include a bracket for mounting the light member underneath a cabinet
  • Allows for easy installation and concealment of the light member
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine.
    * The apparatus is designed to avoid the disadvantages of the known apparatus, such as high blade weight, complex casting, and thermal stresses.
    * The invention uses separate inserts, in the form of strips, which are inserted into the blade and secured in place to separate the cooling channels.
        + The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and can be bent into a U-shape to connect cooling channels.
        + The inserts can be secured using soldering or welding and can be fixed in the blade tip region or root region.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between automatic and manual control.
  • The system includes a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that controls the throttle valve.
    • The control unit can switch to manual control when a malfunction is detected, and the vehicle driver can take control of the throttle valve through the accelerator pedal.
  • The system can also be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, and can switch between automatic and manual control based on the transmission ratio.
    • The system can also include a logic sequencer and phase drivers to control the stepper motor.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a waste fuel burner that emits minimal particulate matter and operates efficiently.
  • It uses a primary combustion chamber with a conical pile of fuel, preheated underfire air, and high-pressure swirl air to gasify the fuel and separate particulate matter.
    • The swirl air is adjustable to maintain a steady temperature at the exit of the primary chamber.
  • The invention also includes a secondary combustion chamber with additional combustion air to complete combustion and remove particulate matter.
    • The secondary air is also adjustable to maintain a steady temperature at the exit of the secondary chamber.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to cool air without adding moisture to the air.
    * It uses a combination of fresh air and return air from the load to be cooled, with the return air being used as the working fluid on the wet side of the heat exchanger.
    * The system is designed to be highly efficient, with an efficiency of up to 90% possible, and is comparable to a vapor compression refrigeration unit of similar capacity.
    * The system can be used in a variety of applications, including residential and commercial cooling systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump of the present invention comprises two or more pump heads arranged in series, with each pump head having a housing, an impeller, and a drive shaft.
    * The pump heads are connected to each other so that the outlet of one pump head is in fluid communication with the inlet of the next pump head.
    * The pump heads are driven by a single drive shaft, which is connected to a motor.
* The pump heads are designed to pump fluid at high volumetric flow rates and high pressures.
    * The pump heads have a unique design that allows them to pump fluid at high volumetric flow rates and high pressures while also being compact and lightweight.
* The pump assembly can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom or a hitching assembly.
    * The support structure allows the pump to be easily moved and positioned in a fluid reservoir.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to engine compression release brakes, and more particularly to engines having engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders.
  • The engine compression release brake system includes a hydraulic system with a high pressure pump, a high pressure manifold, and a low pressure reservoir.
    • The system also includes a solenoid valve that controls the flow of fluid to the hydraulic system.
    • The solenoid valve is actuated by an electronic control module to control the engine compression release brake.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to support structures, particularly a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
  • The mounting link is designed to withstand extreme loads, including those caused by fan blade-off events, without damaging the gearbox or its peripherals.
    • The mounting link includes a female link, a male link, and a pin that selectively retains the links together.
    • The female link receives the male link to allow translation of the male link relative to the female link and to form a radial interface that dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.
    • The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly, the unfused mount components, and the engine mounting structure.
      • The pin is formed of a less durable material than the female link and the male link to facilitate the desired shear characteristics.
      • After the pin is sheared, the female link and the male link are allowed to translate relative to each other, limiting or preventing damage to the gearbox and its peripherals.
    • The radial interface between the female link and the male link provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation.
  • The mounting link can be used in a gearbox assembly that includes a gearbox, driveshaft connection, peripheral load connections, seal, and mounting links.
    • The gearbox assembly is designed to transmit torque from the engine to a variety of peripheral loads not directly related to operation of the engine or to propulsion.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to archery equipment and provides a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight to achieve perfect balance.
    * The point cap system includes a point cap and a balance pin that can be varied in size to achieve the desired weight.
* The invention also provides a point adaptor and a nock cap that can be used to attach arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft.
    * The point adaptor has an internally threaded portion and a hollow cylindrical bore portion, and the nock cap has a hollow cylindrical end and a hollow tapered end.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention Overview
    • The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.
    • It simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.
    • The invention is designed to be cost-effective and reusable.

• Components and Functionality
    • The SAFES consists of ten functional blocks, including a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, and firing control.
    • The bolt interface provides a realistic simulation of operator actions during firing.
    • The trigger interface uses a Schmitt trigger to debounce the trigger signal.
    • The oscillator control circuit uses a D flip-flop to clock the 500 Hertz oscillator.

• Firing Control and Pyrotechnic Ignition
    • The firing control circuit uses thirty-one SCR's to control the ignition of pyrotechnic charges.
    • The pyrotechnic charges are contained in a plastic expendable and are ignited by heating a bridge wire to incandescence.
    • The combustion of the pyrotechnic charges produces a rapid increase in pressure, which simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire.
    • The pressure is vented through the ejection port of the weapon, producing overpressure levels and duration that simulate small arms fire.

• Packaging and Design
    • The SAFES is packaged in a reusable housing that resembles a magazine clip for the M16 rifle.
    • The housing contains the electric control circuitry, the plastic expendable, and the pyrotechnic charges.
    • The plastic expendable is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process, reducing cost.
    • The entire device is designed to be compact and lightweight, making it easy to use and transport.

• Conclusion
    • The SAFES is a cost-effective and realistic simulator for small arms training that can be used with a variety of weapons.
    • It provides a safe and controlled environment for training, reducing the risk of injury or damage to the weapon.
    • The SAFES is an innovative solution for military training and simulation, offering a high level of realism and accuracy.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that aims to improve the engine's performance by utilizing the dynamic effect of air flow while reducing noise from the air intake.
  • The device includes a tank, a first pipe, and a second pipe, which define air passages between the tank and the intake pipe. The first pipe has a larger cross-sectional area than the second pipe, and the second pipe opens to the air intake passage at a location nearer the air cleaner than the first pipe.
  • The device also includes a control valve that is actuated by an actuator in response to an engine operating condition, and a resonator effect is created by the volume of the tank and the narrow passage of the second pipe to absorb noise.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a mounting bracket for speakers or other equipment that can be used on a variety of surfaces, including poles, walls, and columns.
  • It consists of two parts: a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket.
    • The stationary bracket is attached to the mounting surface, while the adjustable bracket is attached to the object to be mounted.
  • The adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position and secured to the stationary bracket using integrated hooks and tabs.
    • The bracket assembly allows for easy installation and adjustment of the object, and can be used to mount a variety of objects, including speakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, and video cameras.
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosed concepts address the need for an efficient, clean burning burner and a system for removably attaching heat utilizing appliances thereto.
  • The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion.
  • The burner also has a shroud providing a second wall surrounding the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and providing an external surface cool enough to avoid burns if casually contacted.
</summary>

<summary>
* The current design of spark plug bosses in rotary internal combustion engines has several drawbacks, including:
	* * The in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses disrupts the flow of cooling fluid, leading to poor heat transfer and increased risk of thermal distortion and failure.
	* * The bosses are also prone to vapor buildup, which can further reduce heat transfer and increase the risk of overheating.
* The proposed solution is to stagger the spark plug bosses in the cooling passageway, allowing for a more uniform flow of cooling fluid and improved heat transfer.
	* * This design also helps to reduce vapor buildup and improve the overall cooling performance of the engine.
	* * The staggered arrangement also allows for a more uniform temperature distribution across the surface of the spark plug bosses, reducing the risk of thermal distortion and failure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
    * The method uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance.
* The method involves calculating the total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position (valve stem lift).
    * The flow change due to closure of one of the N parallel flow valves during valve testing results in a change of the system that is controlling pressure from N valves to N-1 valves.
* The method also involves using a test compensation circuit to adjust the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valves during testing.
    * The test compensation circuit uses a "look up table" to determine the flow compensation required for a given TCV reference.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention relates to mixing valves for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture
    * The invention is specifically designed for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet
    * The outlet mixture can range from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid
    * The invention aims to provide a stand-alone cleaning apparatus that allows multiple users to accomplish specific cleaning tasks without disrupting others
    * The system must be capable of providing a constant pressure cleaning solution with an adjustable cleaning agent to water ratio
* Description of the Preferred Embodiment
    * The valve system includes a valve body, a first inlet passage, a second inlet passage, and an outlet passage
    * The valve body defines a bore with a predetermined diameter and has a first inlet passage and a second inlet passage
    * The first inlet passage is connected to a source of soap solution and the second inlet passage is connected to a source of water
    * The valve system also includes a flow restricting device and a valve member that directs the flow of the fluids
* Operation of the Valve System
    * The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water emerging from the outlet passage
    * The system can operate from approximately 0% water, 100% soap solution to 100% water, 0% soap solution
    * The system includes two mechanisms to maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages
    * The system can be used to clean aircraft and other surfaces with a variety of cleaning agents and pressures
* Other Embodiments
    * The invention can be used in various applications, including public car washes, drain cleaning, and commercial aircraft cleaning
    * The invention can be modified to include additional features, such as a check ball valve to prevent backflow
    * The invention can be used with different types of cleaning agents and fluids
</summary>

<summary>
• Compressor station for compressing gas in a gas pipeline
  • Compresses gas to a higher pressure than the desired exit pressure
  • Cools compressed gas by heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature
  • Expands compressed gas to the desired exit pressure
  • Uses expansion turbines to recover drive energy
  • Operates in two modes: summer and winter
  • Has a lower investment cost and lower risk of accidents compared to traditional re-cooling technology

• Compressor station components
  • Compressors
  • Heat exchangers
  • Expansion turbines
  • Valves
  • Electronic control system

• Summer operation
  • Compressors compress gas to a higher pressure than the desired exit pressure
  • Gas is cooled by heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature
  • Gas is expanded to the desired exit pressure using expansion turbines
  • Drive energy is recovered in the expansion turbines

• Winter operation
  • Compressors compress gas to the desired exit pressure
  • Gas is cooled by heat exchange to a temperature below 0°C
  • Gas is supplied to the pipeline at a temperature below 0°C
  • Additional compressors are switched off during winter operation

<summary>
• Cooling fans are used to remove heat from electronic components, but traditional fastening methods can be costly and labor-intensive.
    • The present invention discloses a system for eliminating fasteners used to secure cooling fans to an enclosure.
    • The system includes a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier with mounting legs that have resilient leg portions.
    • The mounting legs are designed to compress and expand to secure the motor carrier to the enclosure.
    • The system provides a low-cost and efficient way to secure cooling fans to an enclosure.
</summary>

<summary>
* Spacecraft structures require lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have little inherent damping or vibration dissipation characteristics.
    * This can lead to high vibration levels that compromise instrument functionality.
