    * Kinematic mounts are used to support instruments, but they have limited success in reducing vibration.
* The present invention provides kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from flight loads.
    * The mounts incorporate vibration damping materials to dissipate energy and reduce vibration.
    * The damping materials are frequency-dependent, allowing for high stiffness at high frequencies and low stiffness at low frequencies.
* The invention includes two embodiments of the damper design: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper.
    * The spherical damper uses a viscoelastic material to dissipate energy through shear deformation.
    * The cylindrical slot damper uses o-rings or VEM washers to induce compression/tension in the material.
* The invention also includes a series of flat washers that can be used as an alternative to the o-rings or VEM washers.
    * The washers can be made of aluminum or other materials.
    * The analysis results indicate that the washers can provide up to 10% of critical modal damping.
* The invention can be used in a variety of configurations, including a truss structure or a set of three damped versions of the mount configuration.
    * The truss structure can be used to provide a kinematic mount system.
    * The damped mount configuration can be arranged in a variety of ways, including a classical arrangement pattern.
* The invention provides a center-of-gravity mounting system, which can be used to uncouple the suspension vibration modes of the instrument.
    * This can be useful in applications where dynamic disturbances are inherent within the instrument.
    * The center-of-gravity mounting system can help to reduce the effects of lateral imbalance forces on the instrument.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a clutch unit for a stored energy rotary drive aircraft catapult system.
  * It has a novel and improved design that overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions.
    * The clutch unit has a plurality of interleaved clutch plates and discs, each disc comprising a plurality of arcuate segments in a circumferential arrangement.
    * The clutch unit also has separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates, which minimizes residual drag.
* The clutch unit has a servo control valve that provides extremely accurate fluid pressure control in response to various conditions.
  * The servo control valve is connected to a first stage fluid amplifier and a second stage fluid amplifier, which control the flow rate and fluid pressure of both the main and auxiliary supplies to the clutch unit.
    * The main fluid supply is fed to chambers in the piston and cylinder means of the clutch assemblies, while the auxiliary fluid supply maintains a pressure in the chambers that retracts the clutch plates and reduces residual drag.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a combined engine that uses a combustion cylinder and a cascade of expansion cylinders to capture and convert heat energy into mechanical energy.
    * The combustion cylinder generates hot exhaust gas, which is then expanded in the expansion cylinders to produce additional mechanical energy.
    * The expansion cylinders are designed to capture and convert heat energy from the hot exhaust gas into mechanical energy, allowing for a significant increase in thermal-to-mechanical efficiency.
* The engine can be designed to eliminate the need for a radiator, as the heat energy is captured and converted into mechanical energy, reducing the need for heat dissipation.
    * The engine can also be designed to recover water from the exhaust gas, allowing for a closed-loop system and reducing the need for a large water tank.
    * The engine can also be designed to use a catalytic material to reduce emissions, allowing for a cleaner and more efficient engine.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method for fabricating a precoated steel plate, which includes:
	* * Removing a portion of the precoat at the periphery of the plate to prevent the introduction of the precoat into the molten area during welding and to ensure corrosion resistance.
	* * The precoat is formed by dipping the steel plate in a molten bath of an aluminum alloy, and the removed portion is either brushed or ablated using a laser beam.
	* * The plate is then welded using a continuous welding process, such as laser beam welding, electric arc welding, or plasma welding, to form a welded blank.
	* * The welded blank is then heated to form a surface alloy and undergoes austenizing and quenching to produce a part with the desired mechanical properties.
</summary>

    • The GUI provides a virtual reality representation of the vessel's attitude and listing.

• SCADA algorithm
    • The SCADA algorithm is a software program that optimizes energy extraction and navigation.
    • The algorithm uses a weighted cost or yield raster to assign weights to suggested routes.
    • The algorithm takes into account various factors such as weather data

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined together.
    * The ring segments are welded together in a production step that precedes the formation of the axial profiling.
    * The ring element is produced from a sheet metal material and is composed of at least three flat material ring segments.
    * The flat material ring segments are joined together and welded together via joints that form engagement zones.
    * The ring element is formed into a rolling body guide cage with several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
    * The ring element can be used to manufacture rolling body guide cages for radial bearing cages, axial bearing cages, and groove and angular ball bearings.
    * The invention provides a method for manufacturing a rolling body guide cage from a ring element produced from a sheet metal material.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and systems for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including obtaining latitude and longitude coordinates associated with the customer service location.
    * The system includes a technician server, a global positioning satellite system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer record system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, which has two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit to protect an object against influences of an interfering field.
    * The system uses a virtual sensor to combine the output signals of the two real sensors, and a control algorithm to generate control signals for the compensation coils.
        + The control algorithm can be broadband, selective concerning a frequency range, or selective concerning a frequency.
* The system can also be used with two compensation systems operated directly beside each other, which can cause feedback effects between the systems.
    * The feedback effects can be accounted for by using a 6x6 feedback matrix C, which computationally eliminates the parts of the signals that are crosstalks from an output signal to a virtual signal.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy.
  • The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
  • The bioorthogonal reaction is a chemical reaction that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes.
  • The reaction partner can be introduced into the sample and can react with the intrinsic chemical structure of the sample to form a resonance site.
  • The resonance site can be used to generate a resonance signal as a result of coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
  • The method can be used to selectively accentuate defined structures in a sample and to highlight or make visible chemical structures normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy.
  • The invention is particularly suitable for use in biological samples, such as cells, tissues, and organs.
  • The method can be used to investigate the structure and properties of biological samples at the molecular level.
  • The invention can be used to improve the sensitivity and specificity of CARS microscopy.
  • The method can be used to generate a stable, reproducible background signal in CARS microscopy.
  • The invention can be used to selectively detect specific molecules or structures in a sample.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources.
    • It allows for the comparison of segmentations from different clinicians or autosegmentation programs.
    • The system provides a metric method for evaluating the quality of the segmentations.
    • The metric method can be customized by the user.
    • The system provides a graphical representation of the conformance between the segmentations.
    • The system allows for the identification of missing and extra volume elements.
    • The system provides a quantitative evaluation of the comparison of the two segmentations.
    • The system can be used in the training of clinicians on general contouring and target delineation.
    • The system can be used for periodic quality assurance testing of anatomy auto-segmentation routines and systems.
    • The system provides a report of the comparison of the two segmentations.
    • The system can be used to evaluate the quality of segmentations for radiation therapy treatment planning.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for accelerating the execution of floating point operations, particularly the effective subtraction operation.
    • The effective subtraction operation is accelerated by calculating a difference between a subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument.
    • The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof) before the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments is determined.
    • The subset is chosen so that when the complete difference is determined and the current procedure is determined to be incorrect, the correct resulting fraction is available.
    • The apparatus includes a 7-bit subtraction unit, a detection and logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, a selection logic unit, and a subtraction unit.
    • The 7-bit subtraction unit calculates the difference between the 7 least significant bits of the operand exponent arguments.
    • The detection and logic unit determines the difference between the 6 least significant bits of the operand exponent arguments and selects the procedure based on the result.
    • The shift and selection logic unit selects the procedure based on the 7-bit difference between the operand exponent arguments.
    • The selection logic unit determines the components of the final fraction result calculation based on the result of the detection and logic unit.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and system for tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, which includes storing a first machine-readable code present on an identification (ID) means worn by the patient, a second machine-readable code associated with an order to obtain the specimen from the patient, a third machine-readable code present on an ID means worn by a specimen-taker, and a plurality of specimen containers each having a machine-readable code preapplied thereto.
  • The method includes:
    • Storing the first, second, and third machine-readable codes in a relational manner in a database data structure.
    • Inputting the machine-readable codes into the computer, including the patient's barcode number, the order barcode number, the blood drawer's barcode number, and the vial barcode number.
    • Determining if the patient's barcode number and the order barcode number are related to the same patient, and storing the machine-readable codes in a relational manner in the database data structure if they are related.
    • Outputting a signal to the blood drawer to draw the blood sample and send it to a lab for analysis, and storing the indication of the blood draw completion in the database data structure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide golfers with distance and other information about the golf course.
  • The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and can provide information such as distance to the pin, green size, and pin placement.
• The device can also be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, and hunting, and can be expanded to include features such as data upload and download capabilities and a communications method.
  • The device can be used to provide pre-recorded golf instructions and can be expanded to include features such as a library of information about the golfer's past performance and a system for providing strategic recommendations for future shots.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, i.e., logic and memory.
    *   The system and method eliminate false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
    *   The system and method create customized design rules for different types of memory regions that may be included on a chip, where such customized rules are based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory-based parameters onto a stricter logic-based parameter.
    *   The system and method can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks.
</summary>

<summary>

• **Invention Overview**
	• The invention is a waveguide hologram (WGH) illuminator for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators (SLMs).
	• The WGH illuminator uses a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser.

• **Advantages of WGH Illuminators**
	• They occupy less space than conventional lens illumination systems.
	• They have high diffraction efficiency, approaching 0.99.
	• They do not produce stray light that can enter the instrumentation or the eye of the viewer.

• **Challenges of WGH Illuminators**
	• Alignment of the laser beam is critical.
	• Nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction can occur.
	• The WGH can produce two diffracted beams, one out of each side, which can reduce the useful efficiency and introduce noise.

• **Compensating for Nonuniformity**
	• A posteriori compensation can be done by exposing a photographic emulsion to the uncompensated beam.
	• A priori compensation can be done by recording the hologram nonuniformly so that the reconstructed beam is uniform.

• **Solutions for Two-Sidedness**
	• Absorbing the light emerging from one side with an absorbing paint.
	• Placing a mirror on one side to reflect all of the light into the same direction.

• **Applications of WGH Illuminators**
	• Illuminating SLMs, which can be used to modulate the polarization of the light.
	• Diffracting out only polarized light and using the SLM to modulate the polarization.

• **Recording WGH Gratings**
	• Two basic architectures were used to record the WGH grating: a modified conventional holographic recording system and a system using a prism coupler.

• **Experimental Results**
	• The quality of the reconstructed beams was analyzed from various points of view, including polarization and phase characteristics.
	• About 10% of the light in the source was diffracted out into the +1 diffraction order, and about 30% was coupled out of the edge, scattered and absorbed.

</summary>

<summary>
• **Overview of the Invention**
	• The invention is a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors
	• The test apparatus includes a test head and a retraction and drive mechanism
	• The test head includes a core, primary windings, and voltage and skew pick-up coils
	• The retraction and drive mechanism retracts and rotates the rotor within the test head

• **Components of the Test Apparatus**
	• The test head includes a core, primary windings, and voltage and skew pick-up coils
	• The core is formed of a stack of laminations made of a magnetic material
	• The primary windings are used to excite the rotor
	• The voltage and skew pick-up coils sense the voltage and skew of the rotor

• **Operation of the Test Apparatus**
	• The test apparatus is controlled by a data acquisition and processing system
	• The system includes a data processor and a control processor
	• The data processor acquires and processes data from the test head
	• The control processor controls the retraction and drive mechanism

• **Data Acquisition and Processing**
	• The data processor acquires 32 samples of voltage, current, and skew signals
	• The samples are taken at a rate of 32 samples per cycle of the exciting alternating current
	• The data processor calculates resistance, reactance, skew, dissymmetry, and skew dissymmetry
	• The calculated values are displayed on a display and can be printed on a printer

• **Rotor Testing**
	• The test apparatus tests the rotor by exciting the rotor with an alternating current
	• The rotor is rotated at a rate of one revolution in four seconds
	• The test apparatus acquires and processes data during the test
	• The calculated values are used to determine the quality of the rotor

• **Clutch Mechanism**
	• The clutch mechanism holds the rotor in place during rotation
	• The mechanism includes annular sleeves and o-rings that compress and extend to secure the rotor
	• The mechanism is designed to allow the rotor to be easily mounted and removed
	• The mechanism is designed to securely hold the rotor in place during testing

• **Advantages of the Invention**
	• The test apparatus is designed to test dynamoelectric machine rotors quickly and accurately
	• The apparatus can test multiple rotors without the need for manual intervention
	• The apparatus can provide

<summary>
* The present disclosure provides a method for securing a computing device, including:
	* * Granting, to a managed library, access to native resources of an operating system in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library.
	* * Denying, to a managed application, access to native resources of the operating system, wherein the managed application includes a digital certificate authorizing the managed application to access a specific native resource of the operating system through the managed library.
* The method also includes verifying a digital signature associated with a container that includes the managed application, and loading the managed application.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
    * The invention aims to provide a low-cost, easily constructed identification card that protects the electronic components from damage.
* Problem Statement
    * Prior art identification cards have been made with a rigid core onto which an IC chip and antenna are positioned, which can be damaged by external stresses and bending.
    * The rigid core is then covered with a plastic, encasing the structure in a polymer.
* Solution
    * The invention provides a unique structure that protects the IC chip and antenna by using two relatively shock-absorbing layers, which are encased in two rigid outer laminate layers.
    * The core layer is made of a silica-filled polyolefin, and the antenna and chip are fixed to the core layer.
* Materials
    * The core layer is made of a silica-filled polyolefin, such as TESLIN.
    * The antenna and chip are made of silver-epoxy and IC materials, respectively.
* Process
    * The core layer is pre-shrunk at 105°C for 30 minutes to prevent shrinking during printing and attachment of electronic components.
    * Alkyd resin spids are printed on the bottom side of the core layer, and artwork is printed on the top side.
    * The antenna and chip are attached to the core layer, and the core layer is bonded to a bottom layer using a TXP(3) adhesive layer.
* Lamination
    * The core layer and bottom layer are joined using a free film of adhesive, and holes are cut in the adhesive to accommodate the IC chip.
    * The core layer and bottom layer are then joined using a Tetrahedron press, and the adhesive is allowed to flow and solidify.
* Personalization
    * The identification card can be personalized using an inkjet receiver coating and a Canon 8200 printer.
    * The printed cores are then belt laminated on both sides using 7/3 TXP(0)/KRTY as both the top and bottom laminate.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a memory implementation of a FIFO queue using a tree-shaped data structure.
    * The tree-shaped data structure is used to implement a queue, where the nodes have a given maximum size and the queue is maintained by adding and deleting records.
    * The queue is implemented in a functional memory environment, where updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating and making the update in the copy.
    * The queue can be inverted in constant time and space by changing the value of an inversion bit.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, and more particularly to embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies.
  • The invention provides a method to build EPROM devices using existing DRAM manufacture technologies, allowing for the creation of EPROM memory devices and DRAM memory devices on the same wafer without introducing additional manufacturing cost.
    • The EPROM devices of the present invention have the following advantages: they can be manufactured by any IC technologies, are ideal for embedded applications, and can store large numbers of data at very low cost.
• The invention also provides a method to build EPROM devices without using floating gate devices, using the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors.
  • The SEPROM devices of the present invention have the following advantages: they can be manufactured by any IC technologies, are ideal for embedded applications, and can store large numbers of data at very low cost.
</summary>

<summary>
* Feedback gain determination method for automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) running control
    * The method determines the optimum values of proportional (P), integral (I), and differential (D) gains for the AGV running control
    * The gains are determined by executing a feedback control process and evaluating the stability, accuracy, and response of the control
    * The evaluation functions LR, Svv, and Asv are used to evaluate the P, I, and D gains, respectively
* The method can be applied to various running courses and can determine the optimum gains for each section of the course
    * The gains are determined by executing a feedback control process and evaluating the stability, accuracy, and response of the control
    * The evaluation functions LR, Svv, and Asv are used to evaluate the P, I, and D gains, respectively
    * The gains are determined by function interpolation or by causing the AGV to run continuously along the running course
* The method can be used to improve the stability, accuracy, and response of the AGV running control
    * The gains are determined by executing a feedback control process and evaluating the stability, accuracy, and response of the control
    * The evaluation functions LR, Svv, and Asv are used to evaluate the P, I, and D gains, respectively
    * The gains are determined by function interpolation or by causing the AGV to run continuously along the running course
</summary>

<summary>
    * The invention relates to zoom lenses with a high relative aperture and a high zoom ratio, suitable for use in photographic cameras and video cameras.
        * The zoom lens consists of five lens units: a first lens unit of positive power for focusing, a second lens unit of negative power for varying the image magnification, a third lens unit of negative power for compensating for the shift of an image plane, a fourth lens unit of positive power for making the diverging light beam almost parallel, and a fifth lens unit of positive, negative, positive, negative, and positive powers for forming the image.
        * The lens units are designed to satisfy certain conditions to achieve good correction of aberrations and a high zoom ratio.
        * The conditions include inequalities for the refractive power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit, the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth lens unit, the refractive power ratio of the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit, and the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit.
        * The conditions also include an inequality for the refractive power of the second lens unit.
        * The zoom lens has a total length of 8.109 to 8.1461 times the diagonal of the effective picture frame, which is shorter than the total length of conventional zoom lenses.
        * The zoom lens has a high relative aperture of 1:1.6 to 2.4 and a high zoom ratio of 1-5.56.
        * The zoom lens is suitable for use in photographic cameras and video cameras with image pickup elements of 2/3 inch or smaller.
        * The zoom lens has a good balance of aberrations, including spherical aberration, coma, and chromatic aberration.
        * The zoom lens is designed to be compact and lightweight, making it suitable for use in portable devices.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, or the like.
	* The method involves generating a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through the detector, and converting the charge pulse into an electric signal.
* The device includes a detector, a first amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second amplifier for integrating signals.
	* The first amplifier is used to amplify signals at high frequencies, while the second amplifier is used to integrate signals at low frequencies.
* The device also includes a support capacitor to prevent discharging of the detector and to maintain the detector voltage at a nominal value.
* The device can be used to detect particles in particle accelerators, reactors, diagnostic devices, and other applications.
	* The device can also be used to detect individual particles and integrate multiple particles, allowing for the detection of particle rates and intensities.
* The device can be optimized for specific applications, such as medical technology, electrical power engineering, and scientific research.
	* The device can be used to detect packets of particles, such as those produced in particle accelerators, and to integrate the signals from multiple particles.

</summary>

<summary>
• Automatic spin checking apparatus for driven disc assemblies
  • Measures warpage and frictional engagement of the assembly
  • Compares measured values to standard tolerances
  • Generates external indications of assembly condition
  • Minimizes operator error
  • Stores measurements for statistical process control
  • Includes a microprocessor, servo motor, and optical encoder
  • Operates in a controlled environment with a rigid test enclosure
  • Can be used to test driven disc assemblies for friction clutches in vehicles
</summary>

<summary>
* Face age-estimation system
    * Uses contourlet appearance model (CAM) to extract feature vectors from face images
* CAM is a statistical model of appearance that combines shape and texture information
* Feature vectors are used to train a support vector machine (SVM) to classify faces as young or adult
* SVM is trained on a dataset of labeled face images
* CAM is used to extract feature vectors from test images
* SVM is used to classify test images as young or adult
* Based on classification result, an appropriate aging function is used to estimate the age of the face
* Aging functions are trained on the same dataset as the SVM
* Estimated ages are provided in the form of a single age or age indicator, with an optional confidence factor
* System can be used for various applications, such as age-based access control and age-related product recommendation
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images.
    * The device has a matrix of pixels, a controller, and a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels.
    * The mosaic is formed by a plurality of identical arrangements of four pixels, each arrangement being dedicated to the display of a first image and a second image.
    * The first image is displayed on a first number of pixels of each arrangement, and the second image is displayed on the remaining pixels of each arrangement.
    * The controller applies light intensity signals to the pixels to form the merged image.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle.
  * The transmitter has a housing with a receptacle for a payment element, which can be removed from the receptacle in a secure state.
  * The payment element can be brought into data communication with an electronic payment system, and can have a credit card function and/or a debit card function.
  * The transmitter also has electronics and a communication means for communication with the security system of the motor vehicle.
* The transmitter has a closure that can be moved between an active position and a passive position, and can be designed as a dummy plug or a cap that pivots or slides.
  * The closure can be used to seal off the contact elements in the receptacle and protect them from the external environment.
  * The closure can also be used to seal off the electronics and their attached electronic components.
</summary>

<summary>
* An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, becomes inactive when not in use and is put into a "sleep mode" to save energy. When the device "wakes up", it starts warming up and performs imaging operations with toner.
    * The toner used in such an imaging device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge (also known as tribo).
    * The tribo charge of the toner greatly affects the image quality in an imaging operation.
    * The imaging device includes a toner concentration (TC) sensor that measures the concentration of the toner in the developer by detecting the tribo charge of the toner.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention of a rotary magnetic head type apparatus
  • The apparatus controls the bias currents of plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum
  • The bias currents are controlled with a single control signal transmitted from the stationary side
• The apparatus includes a control signal generator, a decoder, and a regenerative integrated circuit
  • The control signal generator generates control signals for the MR heads and the regenerative integrated circuit
  • The decoder discriminates the control signals and outputs control signals to the regenerative integrated circuit
  • The regenerative integrated circuit controls the bias currents of the MR heads
• The apparatus can switch between the MR heads at every 180° turn of the rotary drum
  • The switching is controlled by the decoder and the regenerative integrated circuit
  • The apparatus can also record data onto a magnetic tape using recording heads
• The apparatus can be used in a rotary magnetic head type apparatus with a double azimuth (DA) structure
  • The DA structure includes four recording heads and four MR heads, paired in two pairs
  • The apparatus can record and reproduce data at a faster speed than a single azimuth structure
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improving the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one object in the presence of an adjacent object.
  • The invention uses a transmitter with a pair of antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver that senses the magnetic fields associated with the currents.
    • The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the objects, and the receiver is moved relative to the transmitter and the objects to produce an output signal dependent upon the sensing of both fields.
  • The invention produces two distinct output signal nulls over respective objects, allowing for easier and more accurate location and tracing of the objects.
    • The invention is useful in an environment where the horizontal separation between the objects is related to the depth of the object to be located and traced.
  • The invention is especially useful when the horizontal separation is less than 11/2 times the depth of the object.
    • The invention can be used with different techniques to make the currents in the respective objects distinguishable, such as using different carrier frequencies, amplitude-modulating the currents, or pulsing the currents at different rates.
  • The invention can be used with a receiver that amplifies and detects the combined signal from the objects, and produces a pulsating output signal that is easier for the operator to distinguish from background noise.
    • The invention can be used with a receiver that has a threshold sensitivity control to optimize the performance of the receiver.
  • The invention can be used with a transmitter that is designed to energize only one of the antennae for cable locating and tracing when only a single cable is present.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
  • The apparatus includes a source of power, a selective switch, and a coupler for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker phone when the switch is actuated.
    • The coupler is optically coupled to a photocell or an optocoupler, which is triggered by the ringing signal of the telephone network.
    • The apparatus also includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the interconnection and a bypass switch for bypassing the timer.
• The invention has several modes of operation, including regular operation, automatic connection, termination of calls at the end of an adjustable predetermined time, and manual cancellation of the timed conversation.
  • The apparatus can be embodied in electronic or electromechanical forms, with the electronic embodiment using a timer IC and the electromechanical embodiment using a photocell relay.
</summary>

<summary>
• **Overview of the Invention**
	• The invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplying energy to those amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals.
	• The system uses a trunk and branch structure with a ring geometry to provide strong survivability features.
	• The invention is particularly well-suited for undersea applications, but can also be used in terrestrial communications systems.
• **Key Components**
	• The system includes a hub assembly with remote pumping, a hub assembly without remote pumping, and branch assemblies.
	• The hub assemblies are optically connected via an optical fiber cable trunk in a ring topology.
	• The branch assemblies include a cable station, a light emitting power source, and a branching unit.
• **Operation**
	• The system uses a light emitting power source to pump energy into the optical fiber cable trunk, which is then used to amplify signals in the optical amplifier.
	• The system can be used to amplify signals in the 1500-1600 nm range, which is a window of low attenuation losses for transmission along a single mode fiber optic cable.
	• The system can be used to reduce the number of undersea repeaters required, which can reduce the cost and complexity of the system.
• **Advantages**
	• The system provides strong survivability features, including the ability to maintain connectivity in the event of a cable cut.
	• The system can be used to reduce the number of undersea repeaters required, which can reduce the cost and complexity of the system.
	• The system can be used to amplify signals in the 1500-1600 nm range, which is a window of low attenuation losses for transmission along a single mode fiber optic cable.
	• The system can be used in both undersea and terrestrial communications systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices, which provides a finished look without exposed fasteners.
  * It has a two-part design, consisting of an attachment plate and a cover plate.
    * The attachment plate is attached to the wiring device using screws and has latching pawls that engage with saw-tooth shaped racks on the cover plate.
    * The cover plate has a front face with a central aperture for the wiring device and a back face with a ridge and saw-tooth shaped racks.
  * The device can be used with various types of wiring devices, such as switches, receptacles, and combination devices.
    * The attachment plate has multiple apertures for different types of wiring devices.
    * The cover plate has multiple tabs that can be accessed through slots to facilitate installation and removal.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen.
  * The device consists of annular strips that are concentrically nested and essentially enclose one another in a tight manner.
* The light-shielding device is characterized by a number of annular strips that are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and surround the screen.
  * The strips are suitable to slide over one another between a pushed-in position, in which they essentially cover one another, and a pushed-out position, in which they are essentially uncovered.
* The light-shielding device can be folded around the displaying screen so that it is of very small size.
  * In the folded-in state, the shielding device takes up relatively little space and therefore does not form an obstruction.
* The light-shielding device can be fitted to a screen, for example using Velcro.
  * The strips of the light-shielding device can be of solid design, for example produced by injection-moulding, but may also be produced by bending plate material, preferably provided with integrated hook or locking elements.
* The invention provides a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of as few parts as possible, is inexpensive to produce, operates reliably and can easily be fitted to a monitor.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to automated speech technologies that provide an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can understand.
    * The invention includes a device that monitors the rate of speech during a discourse and compares it to a speaking rate threshold, which is based on the listener's language proficiency and speaking rate.
    * The device can also detect the language being spoken and adjust the speaking rate threshold accordingly, and can provide an option to shift the language of the discourse to an alternative language that is shared by both the speaker and the listener.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which allows for a higher picture sequence frequency.
  • It uses a cyclic line counter to control the vertical deviation of the beam and a sawtooth generator to control the horizontal deviation.
  • The device can be used to record processes that require a higher picture sequence frequency than the standard 25 Hz of a TV camera.
  • The device can be adjusted to record a picture sequence frequency of up to 2000 Hz, which is 40 times higher than the standard 25 Hz.
  • The device can be used to record IR, UV, or X-ray pictures, and can be used for analysis purposes.
  • The device can be adjusted to record a picture sequence frequency of up to 2000 Hz, which is 40 times higher than the standard 25 Hz.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to multimedia communications and a technique for handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services.
    • The invention provides a solution for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call.
    • The invention takes an incoming call from a remote caller and accesses a database to determine if the intended recipient has blended capabilities.
    • If the recipient has blended capabilities, the call is referred to a blender software, which initiates two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.
    • The blender software keeps control of the signaling paths of the parallel components and allows the bearer path to be controlled to accommodate multimedia requests.
    • The invention also provides a methodology for an outgoing voice call from a client, which involves passing the call to a blender software and then to a multimedia server.
    • The blender software separates the call into a call request and a multimedia request and passes the call request to a telephony server.
    • The invention also provides a methodology for an outgoing multimedia call from a client, which involves sending an instant message to the destination client and then passing the call to a blender software.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is related to content synchronization frameworks using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices.
    * The invention provides a central reference point that processes synchronization requests from connected devices and returns responses to the devices.
* The central reference point is hosted by a server and communicates with connected devices and external partners over a network.
    * The server processes synchronization requests by analyzing the requests and determining bundles needed to fulfill the requests.
* The invention provides for the creation of a delta list of bundle files that need to be downloaded to the client device.
    * The delta list is created by comparing the client's local copy of the files with the server's response.
* The invention also provides for the compression of responses to reduce the size of the data transmitted over the network.
    * The compression is preferably performed using a compression algorithm such as gzip.
* The invention provides for the caching of responses to reduce the load on the server and improve response times.
    * The caching is preferably performed using a cache control mechanism such as HTTP caching.
* The invention provides for the ability to prioritize the download of files based on their importance.
    * The priority is preferably determined by the server and is based on the type of file and the client's context.
* The invention provides for the ability to handle errors and exceptions during the synchronization process.
    * The errors and exceptions are preferably handled by the client and the server using error handling mechanisms such as try-catch blocks.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention provides a system and method for allowing a person to anonymously communicate with the owner of a lost or misplaced object.
	* The system includes a virtual locale, a database for storing an association between owner contact information and a unique ID, and a module for forwarding finder communications to the owner.
	* The system allows the owner to register the ID and associate it with their contact information.
	* The finder can then use the ID to communicate with the owner anonymously.
	* The system includes a finder main menu that allows the finder to view open cases, edit their account settings, and search for an ID number.
	* The system also includes an owner main menu that allows the owner to view open cases, edit their account settings, and add a new tag.
	* The system uses anonymous email addresses to protect the privacy of the owner and finder.
	* The system includes a server that periodically checks for incoming email and forwards it to the appropriate party.

</summary>

<summary>

* Introduction to the Foil Electron Multiplier
	* The foil electron multiplier is a new design for electron multiplication
	* It uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons
	* The foils are arranged in a series of stages, with each stage having a different voltage applied to it
	* The foil electron multiplier is designed to be more efficient and have a higher gain than traditional electron multipliers

* Advantages of the Foil Electron Multiplier
	* Higher gain per stage than traditional electron multipliers
	* Fewer stages required to achieve the same gain
	* Can be used in a variety of applications, including photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors
	* Can be used to detect particles such as electrons, ions, and photons

* Design of the Foil Electron Multiplier
	* The foil electron multiplier consists of a series of thin foils, each with a different voltage applied to it
	* The foils are arranged in a series of stages, with each stage having a different voltage applied to it
	* The foil electron multiplier is designed to be more efficient and have a higher gain than traditional electron multipliers
	* The foil electron multiplier can be used in a variety of applications, including photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors

* Operation of the Foil Electron Multiplier
	* The foil electron multiplier operates by accelerating electrons through a series of thin foils
	* The electrons are accelerated by the voltage applied to each foil
	* The electrons are multiplied at each stage, resulting in a higher gain
	* The foil electron multiplier can be used to detect particles such as electrons, ions, and photons

* Applications of the Foil Electron Multiplier
	* Photomultiplier tubes
	* Particle detectors
	* Electron spectrometers
	* Mass spectrometers
	* Photonic detectors

* Conclusion
	* The foil electron multiplier is a new design for electron multiplication
	* It has a higher gain per stage than traditional electron multipliers
	* It can be used in a variety of applications, including photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors
	* It is a more efficient and effective way to multiply electrons than traditional electron multipliers

<summary>
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows ordinary 2-dimensional motion pictures to be viewed in part as a 3-dimensional experience.
    * It takes advantage of the Pulfrich effect, where lateral motion of an ordinary motion picture appears to the viewer in 3-dimensions.
    * The system consists of glasses with individually controllable lenses, a digital photo sensor, and a computer processor.
* The glasses have three states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear.
    * The clear-clear state is for normal viewing, while the clear-darkened and darkened-clear states are used to create the 3-dimensional effect.
    * The darkening of the lenses is controlled by the computer processor, which processes the digital images and identifies synchronization events.
* The system works with any type of motion picture, including film, digital, and animation.
    * It does not require special equipment for filming or projection, and can be used with a TV, DVD player, PC, or movie house.
* The system reduces eyestrain and discomfort by only activating the darkening of the lenses when sustained lateral motion is detected.
    * The battery-powered viewer glasses are controlled in real-time by an intelligent processor packaged with the glasses.
* The system has several advantages, including the ability to view older motion pictures with a 3-dimensional effect, and the ability to work with any type of motion picture format.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw.
  • The method includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on the semiconductor wafer and then applying a mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate individual die on the wafer.
    • The apparatus comprises a pad for supporting a semiconductor wafer and a positioning member to position the semiconductor wafer on the pad.
    • A pressure mechanism is provided to apply a mechanical pressure to the wafer so as to singulate the individual die on the wafer.
  • The method and apparatus are designed to overcome the problems associated with the use of a wafer saw, such as slow processing time, maintenance issues, and chipping of the wafer.
    • The method and apparatus are also designed to be more efficient and cost-effective than traditional dicing methods.
</summary>

<summary>
* Background of the Invention
    * The present invention relates to field emission display devices and methods for fabricating the same.
    * The invention is directed to a novel protection structure for deflecting the discharge path of gas ions away from a cathode in a field emission display device.

* Objects of the Invention
    * To provide a novel protection structure for preventing burnout damage to field emission elements in a field emission display device.
    * To provide a novel field emission display device having a protection structure that substantially prolongs the lifetime of field emission elements in the device.

* Detailed Description of the Invention
    * The present invention is directed to a field emission display device which includes a structure for deflecting the discharge path of gas ions away from a cathode.
    * The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode which is provided in the field emission device, typically on the cathode.

* Exemplary Embodiments
    * A first exemplary structure of FED device according to the present invention is illustrated in FIG. 4.
    * A meshwork-shaped or net-shaped protection structure including reduction plates is provided on the cathode plate of the FED device.

* Claims
    * The scope of the invention is to be defined only by the claims appended hereto, and by their equivalents.
    * The particular order of the steps set forth in the specification should not be construed as limitations on the claims.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes.
    * It overcomes the limitations of prior art image sensors, which can only image a single plane.
        * The prior art image sensors are formed on flat, circular semiconductor substrates and can only be used in certain applications.
        * The present invention provides an image sensor that can be used in various applications, including simultaneous imaging of multiple planes.
* The image sensor has a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges between the surfaces.
    * One of the edges has a surface that is receptive to light.
        * The image sensor includes an image sensor element formed in the substrate and located adjacent the one edge.
        * The image sensor element includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region in which charge carriers are generated by light impinging on the surface of the one edge.
* The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, including the top surface and the edge surfaces.
    * The image sensor can be used in various applications, such as simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or the surface imaging of passageways.
        * The image sensor can also be used for color applications, such as scanning a color document in a single pass.
</summary>

<summary>
• Home network power management
    • Power management is desirable for home networks to reduce energy consumption
    • Energy Star guidelines require devices to reduce power consumption when not in use
• Network master node
    • Performs network administrative functions and nominal device functions
    • Can enter power save mode to reduce energy consumption
    • Can transfer network administrative functions to a slave node
• Network slave node
    • Can perform nominal device functions
    • Can accept network administrative functions from a master node
    • Can become a master node if the current master node is not present
• Power management mode
    • A device can enter power save mode to reduce energy consumption
    • A device can transfer network administrative functions to a slave node before entering power save mode
    • A device can automatically become a master node if no master node is present
• Network administrative functions
    • Include beacon transmission, device association and authentication, admission control, and bandwidth assignment
    • Can be transferred from a master node to a slave node
    • Can be performed by a slave node after transferring from a master node
• Selection criteria
    • Can be based on visibility of a device on the network
    • Can be based on intelligence/functional capabilities of a device
    • Can be based on user selection
</summary>

<summary>

• Background of the Invention
	• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
	• The directional properties of antennae and the processing of phase and amplitude information from separate antenna elements have long been used for determining the angle of arrival of signals, and thus determining the direction of the source transmitter.
	• However, low elevation angles are difficult to measure because of interference from strong unquantifiable reflections from the ground.

• Related Art
	• A unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of similar antenna elements was identified in U.K. Patent No. 1449196, which when placed orthogonal to a reflecting ground plane, could be used to determine a function of elevation angle which was independent of the unknown ground reflection coefficient.
	• The prior art of UK 1449196 is illustrated in FIG. 1, which shows a single equi-spaced triplet for which the two R.F. outputs A+C and B are shown to be:

	• The invention extends these ideas to optimize angle measurements, using the triplet itself, notably over selected sectors at low elevation angles.

• Summary of the Invention
	• It is one object of this invention to overcome the ambiguity of angle measurement.
	• According to this invention, an antenna array for operation by radio interferometric techniques comprises at least four antennae spaced so as to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, each triplet being characterized by the spacing of its elements and the height of the centre element above the ground plane.

• Detailed Description of Exemplary Embodiments
	• In FIG. 2, three triplets of a general set are shown, each having three antennae A, B and C spaced in line at right angles to, and above a ground plane, shown shaded.
	• The three triplets are respectively referenced a, b and q, and have different spacings d, and different heights h above the ground plane of the central antenna B in each triplet.
	• Only three triplets are shown, but in principle two or more can be provided.

• Practical Embodiment
	• FIG. 3 shows seven antenna elements deployed as three triplets arranged to operate on responses from secondary surveillance radar interrogations, at a wavelength of about 30 centimeters.
	• The design aims to provide unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees, and to provide measurement accuracy and resolution of the order +/-0.05 degrees from

<summary>
• The invention relates to a high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamp, subminiature lamp, lamp assembly, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid tight seal.
  • The conventional subminiature lamp has a glass envelope supported by a metal sleeve, which is fixed by an adhesive.
    • The adhesive eventually breaks down due to thermal cycling and chemical degradation.
    • The adhesive also allows moisture to migrate into the lamp, causing electrical contacts to corrode.
    • The invention proposes a polymeric seal support that surrounds and compresses the glass envelope.
      • The polymeric seal support is made of a fluoroelastomer, such as VITON, which has high heat resistance and chemical resistance.
      • The seal support is molded to fit around the glass envelope and the abbreviated height one piece conductive base.
      • The seal support provides a liquid tight seal and eliminates the need for adhesive.
    • The invention also includes a potting material that is poured into the space within the abbreviated height one piece conductive base to minimize air volume and prevent gas penetration.
      • The potting material is preferably silicone and is used to fill the space between the glass envelope and the abbreviated height one piece conductive base.
      • The potting material provides a barrier against gases and prevents them from penetrating into the hot subminiature lamp end.
</summary>

<summary>
• GDFE Precoder for MU-MIMO systems
  • Configures a GDFE Precoder for a base station with multiple antennas and multiple user terminals
  • Reduces computational cost while maintaining system capacity

• System Model
  • Base station with N antennas and K user terminals with Lk antennas each
  • Channel gain matrix Hk between BS and kth UT
  • Input symbol vector uk destined for kth UT
  • Input covariance matrix Sxx for downlink channel

• GDFE Precoder
  • Interference pre-cancellation block I-G
  • Feedforward filter F
  • Transmit filter B
  • Least Favorable Noise Covariance Matrix Szz

• Computation of GDFE Precoder Matrices
  • Compute C using Szz
  • Compute F using C
  • Compute G using F
  • Compute B using F

• Numerical Example
  • Compute C using Szz
  • Compute Sxx for downlink channel
  • Compute V and Σ using Sxx
  • Compute Szz using technique described in reference [4]
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, which aims to increase the intake airflow rate without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements to enhance the heat-dissipating performance of the fan.
  • The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing for receiving the impeller, with the housing having a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to another opening.
    • The sidewall of the passage extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake or discharge area for the air streams.
    • The sidewall of the passage can extend radially outwards with respect to a central axis of the passage in a symmetrical manner.
    • The sidewall of the passage can extend radially outwards with respect to a longitudinal axis of the passage and beyond the peripheral edge of the outer frame.
  • The heat-dissipating device can be used in a system casing with electrical elements mounted thereon, and the heat-dissipating device can be mounted to a proper position to discharge air streams toward the heat sources or electrical elements.
  • The heat-dissipating device can be used with a heat sink, which can be mounted to the heat-dissipating device by screws, and the assembly can be mounted to a central processing unit (CPU).
  • The design of the inclined portion of the sidewall of the passage of the heat-dissipating device can be utilized to guide air streams toward the central portion of the heat sink having the highest temperature, and the heat-dissipating effects can be effectively achieved accordingly.
</summary>

<summary>
* Electroluminescent display panel with a simple structure
    * No intermediate electrode is needed
    * The display panel can display different colors by changing the voltage level
    * The display panel can be used as an instrument panel for an automobile
    * The display panel can be driven by a driving voltage in the vicinity of the threshold voltage of the single layer portion or the double layer portion
* The display panel has a pixel matrix formed by the first and second electrodes
    * The first and second electrodes are made of ITO and are formed into stripes
    * The first and second electrodes are insulated by the first and second insulation layers
    * The first and second luminescent layers are made of ZnS and are formed into a single layer portion and a double layer portion
* The display panel can display different colors by changing the width of the second luminescent layer
    * The width of the second luminescent layer can be changed by adjusting the etching time
    * The width of the second luminescent layer can also be changed by adjusting the etching gas flow rate
    * The width of the second luminescent layer can also be changed by adjusting the etching temperature
* The display panel can display different colors by changing the thickness of the second luminescent layer
    * The thickness of the second luminescent layer can be changed by adjusting the sputtering time
    * The thickness of the second luminescent layer can also be changed by adjusting the sputtering power
    * The thickness of the second luminescent layer can also be changed by adjusting the sputtering pressure
* The display panel can display different colors by changing the material of the second luminescent layer
    * The material of the second luminescent layer can be changed to ZnS:Ce
    * The material of the second luminescent layer can also be changed to SrS:Ce
    * The material of the second luminescent layer can also be changed to other materials
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable communications terminal for internet telephony, which uses a network and/or the internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc.
	• The terminal comprises audio means for reproducing sound on the basis of a first electrical signal and recording sound resulting in a second electrical signal, converting means for converting the second electrical signal into transmission data, and protocol means for handling and controlling communication of the received and transmission data in accordance with a standardized internet/network protocol.
	• The terminal also comprises wireless communications means for wireless near-field communication of the received and/or transmission data in a wireless data format with a connecting unit adapted to establish a connection to a network and/or the internet.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, which includes growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate, and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.
  • The buffer layer is preferably a germanium layer, which reduces the reactivity at the surface and enhances the epitaxy of the deposited oxide.
  • The invention also provides a structure that includes a non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer, a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer, and a top electrode, with a second buffer layer of a stable ferroelectric material between the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer and the top electrode.
</summary>

<summary>

* The existing receiver input circuits have a problem with signal actuation of non-linear components, causing distortions.
	* The problem is caused by the limited dynamic characteristics of passive and active semiconductor components.
	* The existing circuits use amplification control to protect the components from strong signal drives, but this control causes noise and distortion.
* The invention provides a receiver input circuit with a control loop for amplification control, using a control signal derived from the intermediate frequency signal.
	* The control signal is used to control the amplification of the input network, the preamplifier stage, and the mixer stage.
	* The control signal is derived from the output of the preamplifier stage, the mixer stage, and the intermediate frequency amplifier.
* The invention uses a PIN diode control network to control the amplification of the input network.
	* The PIN diode control network is used to avoid overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes.
	* The PIN diode control network is also used to protect the input circuit from high-voltage discharge surges from the antenna.
* The invention provides a tunable selective circuit with a variable reactance network and a PIN diode control network.
	* The tunable selective circuit is used to provide high selectivity and a wide control range.
	* The PIN diode control network is used to control the amplification of the input network and to protect the input circuit from overloading.
* The invention also provides a method for iteration-free alignment of the tunable circuits of the receiver input circuit.
	* The method uses a PLL circuit to generate a manipulated variable for the tuning voltage.
	* The method also uses a C alignment process to align the resonant circuits of the tunable selective circuit.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system and method for setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between two or more parties to a telephone call.
    * The system includes a telephone and a PC connected to a LAN, with a collaboration control program running on the PC.
    * The collaboration control program communicates with the phone to control the collaborate indicator and sense actuation of the collaborate button.
    * The system allows for spontaneous setup of a shared workspace, without complex and time-consuming setup processes.
    * The system is applicable to various scenarios, including video conferencing, document sharing, and shared "whiteboarding".
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to inserting advertising clips into a video sequence.
    * The method generates a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point.
    * The method also generates a salience map for each advertising clip and determines a degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of the advertising clip.
* The method selects the advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity and inserts it into the video sequence at the insertion point.
    * The insertion point can be a shot change in the video sequence or a predefined point defined in the metadata accompanying the video sequence.
    * The method can also be used to insert the advertising clip at regular intervals of time into the sequence.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections, resulting in lower electrical breakdown in small dimension semiconductor devices.
  • The recessed mask structure is used to position the mask below the surface to be planarized, where the surfaces of the regions separated by the dielectric are undisturbed and have complete integrity.
  • The invention provides a lower and predictable overall capacitance, which is valuable for faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring.
</summary>

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer is a novel design for an analog-to-digital converter that uses digital signal processing techniques to convert a modulated IF signal to a digital representation.
    * It consists of a predictive loop that generates a prediction of the input signal at the next sampling epoch, and a sampler that converts the error signal to a digital representation.
        * The predictive loop uses a digital filter to minimize the prediction error signal and generate a digital representation of the input signal.
        * The sampler uses a 1-bit ADC to convert the error signal to a digital representation, which is then used to generate the digital output.
* The predictive filter is implemented as a digital filter with adjustable parameters, allowing it to be reprogrammed to match the input signal.
    * The filter can be adjusted to track the instantaneous carrier frequency of the modulated IF signal, allowing it to maintain a high signal-to-quantization noise ratio.
        * The filter can also be adjusted to reduce distortion caused by interfering signals in a multi-channel receiver application.
* The Downconverting Digitizer has several advantages over conventional analog-to-digital converters, including a reduced implementation cost, a higher dynamic range, and a lower noise bandwidth.
    * The predictive filter can be designed to have a higher order, allowing it to provide a deeper notch in the quantized error signal spectrum and a greater dynamic range.
        * The use of a 1-bit ADC and a digital filter allows the Downconverting Digitizer to achieve a higher precision and a lower power consumption.
</summary>

<summary>
* Fabrication of the Multiplex Detection Array
    * The multiplex detection array is fabricated using a series of fabrication steps, including the deposition of a semiconducting active layer, patterning of the layer using nanoimprint lithography, and the creation of a set of parallel nanotraces.
    * The nanotraces are patterned over the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes, and are designed to have a large surface-to-volume ratio to increase the response sensitivity to target molecule binding.
    * The fabrication process also includes the deposition of a gate dielectric layer, a gate electrode, and a source electrode, as well as the creation of a set of parallel drain electrodes.
* Electrical Architecture for Addressing Each Drain Electrode
    * The electrical architecture of the multiplex detection array includes a set of parallel drain electrodes, each of which is connected to a drain electrode stub bonding pad.
    * The drain electrodes are created by patterning a series of "vias" through an insulating oxide layer, and are designed to be electrically isolated from the underlying layer.
    * The electrical architecture also includes a set of source electrodes, which are connected to a source electrode bonding pad.
    * The source electrodes are designed to be contiguous with the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes.
* Method for Patterning the Base Electrode Structures
    * The base electrode structures are patterned using a series of fabrication steps, including the deposition of a gate dielectric layer, a gate electrode, and a source electrode.
    * The gate dielectric layer is deposited over the entire wafer, and is designed to provide a means to prevent shorting of the gate electrode to the substrate.
    * The gate electrode is patterned using a photoresist layer, and is designed to be contiguous with the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes.
    * The source electrode is patterned using a photoresist layer, and is designed to be contiguous with the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes.

<summary>
• The present invention provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe in order to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
  • The singulation and plating process can be performed using full cutting or partial cutting.
    • Full cutting involves cutting the leadframe in a single operation to form individual semiconductor packages.
    • Partial cutting involves cutting the leadframe in multiple operations to form individual semiconductor packages, with the second cut forming a step on the side of the semiconductor package.
• The plating material is preferably a material configured not to react with oxygen, and can be a metallic material such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN).
    * The mobile terminal has a first network module for connecting to the WWAN and a second network module for connecting to the WLAN.
* The WWAN has a plurality of first base stations, and the WLAN has a second base station that gathers service information of the first base stations.
    * The service information includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes of the first base stations.
* The mobile terminal can turn on the first network module according to a first rule, such as when the signal level of the transmitting signal from the second base station is smaller than a first predetermined threshold.
    * The second network module receives the service information from the second base station and passes it to the first network module.
    * The first network module selects a serving base station from the first base stations according to the service information and connects to the WWAN.
</summary>

<summary>
* Invention Overview
    * Provides a new process for manufacturing multilayered components, such as capacitors, coils, and resistors
    * Eliminates the need for cutting and laminating, reducing labor and cost
    * Enables the production of smaller, more complex components with improved reliability

* Process Steps
    * Provide a carrier, such as a decal, and prepare it for use
        * Punch holes in the decal for guide posts
        * Apply a transfer release agent to the decal
    * Deposit multiple electrodes on the decal
        * Use a screen printing process to deposit the electrodes
        * Cure the electrodes at room temperature or with slight heat
    * Deposit electrical components on the electrodes
        * Use a screen printing process to deposit the components
        * Cure the components at room temperature or with slight heat

* Component Deposition
    * Deposit component A on the electrodes
        * Use a dielectric material, such as ceramic, in a liquid carrier
        * Cure the component at room temperature or with slight heat
    * Deposit component B on the electrodes
        * Use a dielectric material, such as ceramic, in a liquid carrier
        * Cure the component at room temperature or with slight heat
    * Deposit component C on the decal
        * Use a dielectric material, such as ceramic, in a liquid carrier
        * Cure the component at room temperature or with slight heat

* Assembly and Firing
    * Stack the components in a specific order
        * Use guide posts to ensure precise registration
        * Remove the decal and any excess material
    * Fire the assembly at high temperatures
        * Melt and fuse the electrodes and components together
        * Form a strong, reliable bond between the components

* Advantages
    * Enables the production of smaller, more complex components
    * Reduces labor and cost
    * Improves reliability and reduces the risk of delamination
    * Enables the production of components with unique shapes and configurations
    * Allows for the use of different materials and technologies
    * Enables the production of components with specific electrical properties
    * Reduces the need for additional processing steps
    * Improves the overall quality and reliability of the components
    * Enables the production of components with high precision and accuracy
    * Reduces the risk of defects and failures

</summary>

<summary>
• Hierarchical lattice structure with unit cells of various sizes
  • Unit cells can be of different shapes, such as tetrahedral, pyramidal, or octet truss
  • Unit cells can be connected to form a lattice structure with a hierarchical order
• Lattice structure can be used as a core for sandwich panels
  • Sandwich panels can be used in various applications, such as aerospace, automotive, and construction
  • Lattice structure can provide high specific stiffness and strength
  • Lattice structure can be used to absorb impact and blast energy
  • Lattice structure can be used as a support system for catalysts
  • Lattice structure can be used as a template for deposition of other materials
</summary>

<summary>
• The process is a co-production of power and hydrocarbons, using a coal-to-liquid (CTL) facility and an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility.
  • The CTL facility includes a dry gasification stage, a gas clean-up stage, a Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis stage, and a product work-up stage.
    • The dry gasification stage produces a synthesis gas precursor, which is then cleaned and converted to hydrocarbons in the Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis stage.
    • The product work-up stage separates the hydrocarbons into LPG, naphta, and diesel.
  • The IGCC facility includes a wet gasification stage, a sour shift stage, a hydrogen-enriched gas expansion stage, a gas clean-up stage, and a gas combustion and expansion stage.
    • The wet gasification stage produces a combustion gas, which is then cleaned and used to generate power in the gas combustion and expansion stage.
    • The sour shift stage converts CO and water to CO2 and H2, which is then used to produce hydrogen-enriched gas in the hydrogen-enriched gas expansion stage.
