<summary>
• Funding for the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) is provided in the annual Energy and Water Development (E&W) Appropriations bill.
  • The Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE) supports renewable energy and end-use energy efficiency technology research, development, and implementation.
• The FY2018 budget request for EERE is $636 million, a nearly 70% decrease from FY2017.
  • The request focuses on "early-stage R&D" and eliminates funding for the Weatherization Assistance Program and the State Energy Program.
• The House Appropriations Committee reported its version of the FY2018 E&W Appropriations bill with a manager's amendment, providing $1.1 billion for EERE, $449 million above the Administration's request.
  • The Senate Committee on Appropriations reported its version of the FY2018 E&W Appropriations bill, providing $1.9 billion for EERE, $153 million below the FY2017 level and $1.3 billion above the Administration's request.
• The House bill would provide funding for sustainable transportation, renewable energy, and energy efficiency, while the Senate bill would provide funding for these areas and also support advanced manufacturing, building technologies, and the Weatherization and Intergovernmental Programs.
  • The Senate bill would continue to support the Weatherization Assistance Program and the State Energy Program, which the Administration's budget would terminate.
• The House bill would provide funding for the Manufacturing Demonstration Facility, the Critical Materials Energy Innovation Hub, the Energy Water Desalination Hub, and Clean Energy Manufacturing Innovation Institutes, while the Senate bill would provide funding for these programs and also support the Combined Heat and Power Technical Assistance Partnerships and Industrial Assessment Centers.
• The Senate bill would also provide funding for equipment and building standards, emerging technologies, and transactive controls R&D, among other areas.
</summary>

* Cryptocurrencies can be used as a medium of exchange, a unit of account, and a store of value.

	* The decentralized nature of cryptocurrencies makes it difficult for governments to regulate them, and some countries have banned their use.
* The future of cryptocurrencies is uncertain, and their adoption is still limited.
	* Some experts believe that cryptocurrencies have the potential to revolutionize the way we think about money and financial transactions, while others are more skeptical about their long-term viability.

* The proposed changes to 11 U.S.C. § 1113 aim to modify the process for rejecting collective bargaining agreements (CBAs) in chapter 11 bankruptcy cases.
	* * The bill would limit the duration of modifications to CBAs to two years, and require that the debtor's proposal be the minimum necessary to reorganize successfully.
	* * The bill would also require the court to consider the impact of the proposed modifications on the labor group and other groups, and would prohibit the court from approving rejection of a CBA if the debtor has implemented a program of incentive pay or bonuses for management personnel.
* The bill would also change the rules regarding the right to strike by labor groups, allowing them to strike even if the CBA contains a "no strike" clause, and would preempt all other federal and state laws regarding labor groups' right to engage in self-help.
	* * The bill would also require the court to grant requests for future modifications to CBAs based on changed circumstances, if the new provisions would result in the minimum savings needed for the debtor to reorganize successfully.
	* * The bill would also require the court to consider the impact of the proposed modifications on the labor group and other groups, and would prohibit the court from approving rejection of a CBA if the debtor has implemented a program of incentive pay or bonuses for management personnel.
</summary>

<summary>
• Gross job loss is a normal part of a functioning labor market, and it is not necessarily a cause for concern.
	• Gross job loss is a natural result of the reallocation of resources to their most efficient use, and it is not necessarily a sign of a problem with the economy.
	• Gross job loss can be offset by gross job gains, and the net effect on employment can be neutral or even positive.
	• Gross job loss can also be a sign of a healthy labor market, as it allows for the reallocation of resources to more productive uses.

• Net job loss, on the other hand, is a cause for concern and is often a sign of a problem with the economy.
	• Net job loss occurs when the number of jobs lost exceeds the number of jobs gained, resulting in a decline in employment.
	• Net job loss can be caused by a variety of factors, including economic downturns, technological change, and changes in consumer demand.
	• Net job loss can have negative effects on the economy, including increased unemployment, reduced consumer spending, and decreased economic growth.
</summary>

* ICE is responsible for ensuring the health and well-being of non-citizens in its custody.
	* * ICE's Detention Standards require that detainees have access to medical care, including emergency care, primary care, and mental health care.
* The Division of Immigrant Health Services (DIHS) is responsible for providing health care to non-citizens in ICE custody.
	* * DIHS provides on-site health care at 15 facilities and approves off-site care at other facilities.
* Detainees have access to sick call, which allows them to request medical attention.
	* * Detainees can request medical attention at any time, and facilities are required to respond to non-emergency requests within 48 hours.
* ICE has a covered benefits package that outlines the health care services available to detainees.
	* * The package includes emergency care, primary care, and mental health care, but does not cover elective or non-emergency care.
* Detainees can appeal denied medical requests to the Managed Care Coordinator (MCC) or the Managed Care Review Committee (MCRC).
	* * The MCC reviews requests and makes a decision, and the MCRC reviews denied requests and makes a final decision.
* ICE has a system in place to report and investigate detainee deaths.
	* * ICE reports detainee deaths to the Office of Professional Responsibility and the Office of the Inspector General, and conducts an investigation into the circumstances surrounding the death.
</summary>

  • The MCA will provide funding to countries that have demonstrated a commitment to good governance, economic freedom, and investing in their people.
    • The funding will be based on a performance-based system, where countries are selected based on their performance in three policy areas: ruling justly, investing in people, and pursuing sound economic policies.
    • The MCA will also provide funding to countries that have a strong track record of economic growth and poverty reduction, but may not necessarily meet the performance-based criteria.

• The MCA has been the subject of some controversy, with some critics arguing that the initiative is too focused on economic growth and not enough on poverty reduction.
  • Others have criticized the MCA for its lack of transparency and accountability, and for the fact that it does not provide enough funding to countries that need it most.
    • Despite these criticisms, the MCA has the potential to be a powerful tool for promoting economic growth and reducing poverty in developing countries, and it is an important step forward in the fight against global poverty.

* The Lacey Act was enacted in 1900 to address game poaching and wildlife laundering.
	* The act regulates the trade of wildlife and plants and creates penalties for violations.
	* The act was amended in 2008 to include non-indigenous plants and foreign laws.
* The 2008 amendments aim to reduce illegal logging and increase the value of US wood exports.
	* The amendments require importers to declare the species, genus, and country of origin of plants and plant products.
	* The declaration requirements are enforced by the US Fish and Wildlife Service, the National Marine Fisheries Service, and the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service.
* The act also requires importers to exercise due care to ensure that plants and plant products are harvested and processed legally.
	* The act creates penalties for violations, including fines and imprisonment.
	* The act does not provide funding for its implementation, but funding can be provided through discretionary appropriations.
	* The act has been criticized for being overly broad and for creating unnecessary burdens on importers.

</summary>

<summary>

* Farming is a cyclical business with price swings that can be destabilizing.
	* Farmers respond to high prices by increasing production, but may not reduce production when prices drop.
	* The farm economy is affected by weather, export demand, currency exchange rates, and foreign farm support and export subsidies.
	* Farmers have asked for federal intervention, including counter-cyclical assistance, for nearly 70 years.
* The 1996 Farm Act ended deficiency payments linked to target prices and replaced them with fixed production flexibility contract (PFC) payments.
	* PFC payments were not linked to current production or prices and were intended to guide farmers' production choices.
	* The 1996 Act also continued marketing assistance loans, which allowed farmers to pledge stored grain, cotton, or oilseeds as collateral for a USDA loan.
* The 2002 Farm Bill restored target prices and deficiency payments, replacing PFC payments with fixed, direct payments to farmers.
	* The new law also maintained marketing assistance loans and loan deficiency payments.
* The 2002 Farm Bill provides new counter-cyclical support for grains, cotton, and oilseeds, including target price deficiency payments and fixed, direct payments.
	* The new law also provides counter-cyclical support for peanuts and dairy farmers.
* The cost of the 2002 Farm Bill is estimated to be $98.9 billion over 6 years, with $23.6 billion of that going towards new counter-cyclical payments.
	* The new law is expected to be in compliance with the World Trade Organization's (WTO) subsidy limits, but there are concerns about the potential for distorting production and trade.
* The new law includes "circuit breaker" language to ensure that trade-distorting farm subsidies do not exceed the WTO's $19.1 billion limit.
	* There are concerns about the administrative, economic, and political implications of changing or reducing benefits after they are announced and/or awarded.

</summary>

* The study compared the effectiveness of two methods for increasing proteome coverage: repetitive LC-MS/MS runs and an additional protein separation step using microsol ief.
	* The repetitive LC-MS/MS runs involved analyzing the same sample multiple times to increase the number of peptides identified.
	* The additional protein separation step involved separating the sample into four fractions using microsol ief before analyzing it with LC-MS/MS.
* The study used a cancer cell lysate as the sample and analyzed it using both methods.
	* The repetitive LC-MS/MS runs involved analyzing the sample four times, with each analysis involving 20 fractions of the sample.
	* The additional protein separation step involved separating the sample into four fractions using microsol ief and then analyzing each fraction with LC-MS/MS.
* The study found that the additional protein separation step resulted in a 22% increase in protein coverage compared to the repetitive LC-MS/MS runs.
	* The additional protein separation step also resulted in a 2.5-fold increase in the number of high-confidence, non-redundant peptides identified.
* The study suggests that the additional protein separation step is a more efficient use of mass spectrometer instrument time than repetitive LC-MS/MS runs.
	* The study also found that the repetitive LC-MS/MS runs resulted in a greater number of false positives than the additional protein separation step.
* The study concludes that the additional protein separation step is a more effective method for increasing proteome coverage than repetitive LC-MS/MS runs.

</summary>

• The study aimed to compare the incidence of secondary, delayed postoperative hemorrhage between tonsillectomy and submucosal uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (SMUPPP) with tonsillectomy.
  • The study found that the incidence of secondary, delayed postoperative hemorrhage was significantly higher in the tonsillectomy group (5.05%) compared to the SMUPPP group (1.45%).
  • The study suggests that suturing both the muscular and mucosal layers of the tonsillar fossa in SMUPPP may decrease the incidence of postoperative bleeding, and that bipolar cauterization followed by tacking with 3-0 vicryl sutures may also be effective in reducing bleeding.

<summary>

* Synthesis of Sulfone-Substituted -Lactams
	* The anhydride mannich reaction (AMR) was used to synthesize sulfone-substituted -lactams
	* The reaction involved the reaction of an imine with a sulfone-substituted anhydride
	* The reaction was found to be highly selective and stereoselective
	* The products were isolated in good yields and high purity
* Mechanism of the Reaction
	* The reaction is thought to proceed through a Mannich-like mechanism
	* The enolate of the anhydride attacks the iminium ion to form a cyclic transition state
	* The reaction is stabilized by hydrogen bonding to the sulfone group
	* The product is formed through a rapid transannular acylation step
* Scope of the Reaction
	* The reaction was found to be applicable to a wide range of imines and anhydrides
	* The reaction was also found to be tolerant of a variety of functional groups
	* The reaction was used to synthesize a range of sulfone-substituted -lactams
	* The reaction was found to be useful for the synthesis of biologically active compounds
* Applications of the Reaction
	* The reaction was used to synthesize a range of biologically active compounds
	* The reaction was used to synthesize a range of heterocyclic compounds
	* The reaction was used to synthesize a range of compounds with potential medicinal applications
	* The reaction was found to be useful for the synthesis of complex molecules
* Conclusion
	* The anhydride mannich reaction is a powerful tool for the synthesis of sulfone-substituted -lactams
	* The reaction is highly selective and stereoselective
	* The reaction is applicable to a wide range of imines and anhydrides
	* The reaction is useful for the synthesis of biologically active compounds and other complex molecules

* The study aimed to investigate the expression of microRNAs (miRNAs) in breast cancer tissues and their relationship with clinical pathology.
	* The study included 35 patients with invasive ductal carcinoma, and the expression of miR-125a, miR-206, miR-145, miR-21, and miR-10b was analyzed.
	* The results showed that the expression of miR-125a, miR-206, and miR-145 was lower in breast cancer tissues compared to para-carcinoma normal tissues.
* The expression of miR-21 and miR-10b was higher in breast cancer tissues compared to para-carcinoma normal tissues.
	* The study found that miR-145 was negatively correlated with tumor size and lymph node metastasis, and was also correlated with negative estrogen receptor (ER) and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) expression.
	* MiR-206 was highly expressed in patients with small tumors, negative ER, negative progesterone receptor (PR), and negative HER2.
	* The study also found that miR-21 was positively correlated with older age, postmenopausal status, and lymph node metastasis, and was also correlated with positive HER2 expression.
	* MiR-10b was positively correlated with tumor size, lymph node metastasis, and positive topoisomerase II alpha (TOP2A) expression.
	* The study suggested that miR-125a, miR-206, and miR-145 may be involved in the suppression of breast cancer invasion and metastasis, and may be used as novel tumor markers for the diagnosis and prognosis of breast cancer.
	* The study also suggested that miR-21 and miR-125a may contribute to the treatment of HER2-positive breast cancer cells, and miR-145 and miR-206 may accelerate the development of treatment methods for triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC).
	* The study concluded that further investigation is needed to verify the detailed mechanism and potential clinical applications of these miRNAs.

</summary>

• The study investigates the expression of transglutaminase 2 (TGM2) in mononuclear leukocytes and graft tissue of rat renal allografts.
	• TGM2 mRNA and protein are overexpressed in mononuclear leukocytes, predominantly by activated monocytes, which accumulate in the vascular bed of rat renal allografts during acute rejection.
		• TGM2 mRNA levels increase by about 10-fold in mononuclear blood leukocytes from day 9 allografts compared to isografts, while TGM2 protein levels do not show a significant increase.
		• TGM2 expression is also induced in graft tissue, with elevated mRNA levels on both days 9 and 42.
		• TGM2 is detected in the cytoplasm of graft blood monocytes and in the surrounding blood plasma, suggesting a potential role in the pathogenesis of chronic allograft injury.
	• The study also investigates the role of TGM2 in the pathogenesis of chronic allograft injury and its potential as a therapeutic target.
		• The results suggest that TGM2 may play a dual role in apoptosis, inducing apoptosis but also stabilizing the cytoskeleton of dying cells.
		• The study also finds that TGM2 is not involved in the pathogenesis of chronic allograft injury, as cystamine treatment did not prevent the development of chronic allograft injury.
</summary>
